Avaaz estimated that the unlabeled posts it found had been viewed 142 million times and received 5.6 million reactions.', 'Avaaz identified 119 pages that had posted misinformation at least three times in the past year.', 'Avaaz identified 46 pages that had shared unlabeled versions of posts that fact-checkers had deemed false.']

mitigation_taken: ['More than 15,000 parents, students, and teachers signed an online petition asking the IB to take a different approach with their grading algorithm and to make it fairer.', 'The IB foundation declined to answer questions about its grading system.', 'The IB foundation said the grading system had been checked against five years of past results.', 'The IB foundation said disappointed students could use its existing appeals process, which requires a fee.', 'The IB foundation released summary statistics showing this year’s average score was slightly higher than last year’s and that the distribution of grades was similar.', 'IB posted a video explaining the grading process in which its assessment manager described the system.', 'A math teacher said he plans to work with a colleague and a statistical software package to probe where the IB formula may have gone wrong.', 'Many students are planning to take the November in-person IB exams as a second chance to obtain written-test results.', 'Anahita Nagpal said she intends to take the November IB exams at a cost of about €700.']

The same information was checked in another post by independent fact-checkers." to the images.', "Facebook reduced the visibility of posts it confirmed to be inaccurate across users' timelines.", "Facebook labeled posts according to independent fact-checkers' ratings, such as false, partly false, altered, missing context, satire, and true.", 'Facebook left the images on the platforms but de-emphasized them instead of removing them entirely.', "Publishers could dispute a fact-check rating and request that the content's validity be rechecked.", "The Nigerian Army labeled the Lekki toll gate event as 'fake news'.", "AFP acknowledged Amnesty International Nigeria's report about the killings in Lagos.", 'Facebook used a hybrid system of human moderators and artificial intelligence to check misinformation.', 'Facebook partnered with certified independent third-party fact-checking organizations to identify, review, and confirm potentially inaccurate content.', 'Facebook flagged content based on feedback from users, its signal technology, or independent fact-checkers.']

mitigation_taken: ['HUD charged Facebook with encouraging and enabling housing discrimination through its targeted advertising practices.', 'HUD conducted a months-long investigation into whether Facebook illegally allowed real estate sellers to restrict their advertisements by characteristics such as race.', 'Facebook agreed to enact sweeping reforms to its ad-targeting system as part of a settlement with civil rights groups.', 'As part of the settlement, Facebook will no longer allow advertisers to target or exclude housing ads by age.', 'As part of the settlement, Facebook will no longer allow advertisers to target or exclude housing ads by gender.', 'As part of the settlement, Facebook will no longer allow advertisers to target or exclude housing ads by zip code.', 'Facebook removed hundreds of targeting options for anyone advertising housing, credit or employment opportunities.', 'Facebook said it will create a new portal to allow users to search for and view housing ads in the U.S. regardless of who the advertisers hoped to target.', 'Facebook eliminated thousands of targeting options last year that advertisers could use to exclude audiences based on ethnicity, gender and religion.', 'Facebook removed thousands of targeting options last August.', 'Facebook reached historic agreements with the National Fair Housing Alliance, the ACLU, and others that change the way housing, credit and employment ads can be run on Facebook.', 'Facebook enacted changes to its platform to undercut misuse by advertisers.', 'Facebook said it would continue working with civil rights experts on these issues.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Maldonado family filed a lawsuit in Alameda County Superior Court alleging defects in Autopilot.', 'Benjamin Swanson, the Maldonados’ lawyer, obtained video and data from Tesla and shared them with The New York Times.', 'A Tesla official said that if a crash occurs the car automatically saves the short video clips and uploads them to Tesla’s servers.', 'In emails filed as exhibits in court, Tesla lawyer Ryan McCarthy asserted that the driver, not the car, bore responsibility for the crash.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has about two dozen active investigations into crashes involving Autopilot.', 'In June, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration released a list showing that at least ten people have been killed in eight accidents involving Autopilot since 2016.', 'In June, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said it would require all automakers to report accidents involving driver-assistance systems like Autopilot.', 'The National Transportation Safety Board completed investigations into accidents involving Autopilot.', 'The National Transportation Safety Board stated that Autopilot lacks safeguards to prevent misuse and does not effectively monitor drivers.', 'The California Highway Patrol arrested a man who got out of the driver’s seat of his Model 3 while it was moving.', 'A lawsuit was filed in April in Florida state court concerning a 2019 Key Largo crash in which a Tesla with Autopilot failed to stop and killed Naibel Leon.', 'A lawsuit was filed in May in California by Darel Kyle over serious spinal injuries he suffered when a Tesla under Autopilot rear-ended his van.']

mitigation_taken: ["PimEyes allows anyone to request a photo's removal using an online form, one image at a time.", 'PimEyes offers a "PROtect" package that completely blocks photos from appearing in PimEyes\'s search results for $79.99 per month.', 'PimEyes deleted a webpage that had stated it had analyzed 900 million unique faces.', 'Half a dozen U.S. states have banned or restricted facial recognition technology for public use.', 'Roughly two dozen U.S. cities have banned or restricted facial recognition technology for public use.', 'The U.S. Government Accountability Office urged Congress to strengthen face-scan laws.', 'Amazon halted its sale of facial recognition technology to police for one year.', 'Microsoft announced it would not sell facial recognition technology to police until a federal law is enacted.', 'An online crowdsourced collective of "sedition hunters" used PimEyes to pursue and identify U.S. Capitol rioters.', "A photo researcher in London spent hours using PimEyes to identify members of the mob that stormed the U.S. Capitol and found a suspect's decade-old mug shot.", 'An AI data scientist using the online name "Patr10tic" used an open-source face extractor to pull facial images from more than 40,000 videos uploaded to Parler.', 'That AI data scientist built a cluster map of those faces and a detailed location map pinpointing where the videos had first been made.']

mitigation_taken: ['OpenAI released GPT-3 only to a restricted group of vetted developers and companies.', 'OpenAI required those vetted developers and companies to minimize potential social harms caused by their applications.', 'OpenAI established an academic access program allowing scholars to request access to probe GPT-3 for bias.', "Abid and his co-authors reduced biased outputs by front-loading the 'Two Muslims walked into a …' prompt with a short positive phrase.", 'OpenAI researchers fine-tuned GPT-3 by giving it an extra round of training on a smaller, more curated dataset.', 'Researchers supplied the original GPT-3 with 80 well-crafted question-and-answer text samples to change its behavior.', 'OpenAI researchers are continuing to experiment with fine-tuning approaches to reduce bias.', 'Another team is attempting to improve the initial training dataset to make it less biased.']
assigned_subcategories: Staged Deployment; Access Management; Testing & Auditing; Model Safety Engineering; Data Governance

mitigation_taken: ['ProctorU employs human proctors who make final decisions on student identity and verify exam integrity.', 'ProctorU uses a diverse group of trained human proctors assisted by technology to safeguard exam integrity and assist students.', "The University of Toronto has vetted and approved ProctorU's systems and protocols for remote test proctoring.", 'The University of Toronto continuously monitors issues that arise around e-proctoring.', 'The University administration issued guidance that e-proctoring should not be the first or only way divisions seek to ensure academic integrity on assessments.', 'Any issues flagged by the e-proctoring system are reviewed in the first instance by instructors.', 'The University of Toronto offers anti-racism and unconscious bias training to all members of its community.', 'The Centre for Teaching Support & Innovation advised that online proctoring should be considered only for unique situations or needs given the additional logistical challenges and potential equity issues.', 'Six Democratic U.S. Senators wrote an open letter highlighting issues of privacy, accessibility, and equity with exam monitoring services.']

mitigation_taken: ["The District Court rejected the farm’s appeal to receive the program's code and accepted the state's position.", 'The farm appealed the District Court ruling to the Supreme Court.', 'The Movement for Freedom of Information asked to join the appeal as a friend of the court.', "The Movement for Freedom of Information submitted a written position arguing that the term 'information' includes software, code, or algorithms.", 'The state retracted its position in the case.', "The Justice Ministry began debating whether software or its source code can be considered 'information' that must be disclosed.", 'The Supreme Court returned the case to the District Court to complete the process.', 'In a related class action, a judge ruled in favor of the plaintiff and ordered Israel to pay compensation of over 2 million shekels.']

mitigation_taken: ["Facebook's integrity team worked to track down exploitations of the News Feed algorithm and figure out how to mitigate them.", "Data scientists on the integrity team worked on a number of potential changes to curb the algorithm's tendency to reward outrage, misinformation, and divisive content.", 'Anna Stepanov presented several proposed changes to Mark Zuckerberg intended to address the proliferation of false and divisive content on the platform.', 'One proposed change would have removed the algorithmic boost given to content most likely to be reshared by long chains of users.', "In April 2019 a Facebook data scientist proposed reducing the spread of 'deep reshares.'", 'Facebook reduced the downstream MSI aspect of its algorithm for civic and health information in the spring of 2020.', 'Facebook had already applied similar downstream MSI reductions in a few countries such as Ethiopia and Myanmar.', 'Facebook announced it was gradually expanding tests to put less emphasis on signals such as how likely someone is to comment or share political content.', 'Facebook researchers and data scientists wrote internal memos flagging unhealthy side effects of the MSI ranking and documenting that misinformation, toxicity, and violent content were disproportionately prevalent among reshares.']

mitigation_taken: ["California sent 'Chapter 6' notices to applicants flagged by the proctoring software alleging issues such as a prolonged lack of facial view or no audible sound.", "California issued 'order to show cause' notices asking many flagged applicants to prove they were not cheating.", 'Flagged cases were to be reviewed by human examiners who are supposed to parse through the video to verify whether flagged behavior was a false positive.', 'Applicants have reportedly been required to respond to vague allegations without being allowed to view the video evidence.']

mitigation_taken: ['Los Angeles County prosecutors filed two counts of vehicular manslaughter against the Tesla driver, Kevin George Aziz Riad.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration sent investigators to the Gardena crash.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board have been reviewing the widespread misuse of Autopilot.', 'NHTSA has sent investigation teams to 26 crashes involving Autopilot since 2016.', 'NHTSA is investigating a dozen crashes in which a Tesla on Autopilot ran into several parked emergency vehicles.', 'NHTSA issued a public statement saying there is no vehicle on sale that can drive itself.', 'NHTSA stated that, whether or not a car is using a partially automated system, every vehicle requires the human driver to be in control at all times.', 'Tesla updated Autopilot software to try to make it harder for drivers to abuse it.', "Tesla attempted to improve Autopilot's ability to detect emergency vehicles.", 'The families of Gilberto Alcazar Lopez and Maria Guadalupe Nieves-Lopez sued Tesla and Kevin Riad in separate lawsuits.', 'A joint trial for the lawsuits against Tesla and Riad is scheduled for mid-2023.', 'In 2020, Rafaela Vasquez was charged with negligent homicide after the Uber autonomous test vehicle struck and killed a pedestrian.', 'A California man was arrested after officers observed his Tesla moving down a freeway with the man in the back seat and no one behind the steering wheel.', 'Arizona prosecutors declined to file criminal charges against Uber after the 2018 autonomous vehicle fatality.']

mitigation_taken: ['Amazon committed over $1 billion in new investments in operations safety measures.', 'Amazon distributed masks to employees.', 'Amazon distributed gloves to employees.', 'Amazon implemented enhanced cleaning and sanitization to protect employees from COVID-19.', 'Amazon installed guardrails to separate forklifts from pedestrians.', 'Amazon increased safety staffing.', 'Amazon offered wellness exercises to employees.', 'Amazon invested in safety training and education programs.', 'Amazon invested in safety technology and new safety infrastructure.', "Amazon's environment, health and safety team sent monthly detailed updates marked 'Privileged & Confidential' to warehouse safety managers with data, charts and FAQs.", 'Amazon set safety goals and monitored progress closely.', 'Amazon piloted rotating workers to different jobs to alleviate repetitive stress.', 'Half of the pilot sites turned off sort rotation during Prime Week.', "Amazon piloted blocking off the highest and lowest shelves on warehouse racks to optimize work allocation to associates' power zones.", 'Five of six warehouses testing the shelf-blocking pilot put the program on hold for the runup to Prime Day.', "Amazon's safety team rolled out an initiative called 'temporary light duty' to reduce lost-time injuries by reassigning injured workers.", "Amazon reassigned injured workers to tag photos on a computer to help train the company's machine learning algorithms as part of temporary light duty.", 'Amazon loaned injured workers to nonprofit organizations as part of temporary light-duty assignments.', 'Amazon terminated the use of an occupational clinic with poor performance for its Thornton, Colorado warehouse.', 'Amazon contracted with Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine as a new clinic for injured Colorado workers.', 'Amazon sought to ensure stronger use of its on-site AmCare first aid clinic and to reduce the probability of associates transitioning to external clinic care.', "Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine's medical director instructed clinic staff to contact her or the clinic owner before giving restrictions or making Amazon cases OSHA-recordable.", 'The owner of Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine decided to stop providing occupational medical care for companies, including Amazon, at the end of the year.', "Amazon's vice president of public policy wrote to U.S. senators asserting the company changed its approach to recordkeeping in 2016 to report all injuries.", "Amazon's senior vice president for global corporate affairs went on CNBC to publicly defend the company's reporting and policies.", "A group of 15 U.S. senators sent a letter to Jeff Bezos demanding a list of changes in Amazon's warehouses.", 'OSHA issued a hazard alert letter against an Amazon robotic warehouse in New Jersey and recommended measures such as an extra rest break and rotating employees to different jobs.', 'OSHA fined Amazon $7,000 for failing to record more than two dozen injuries as required.', 'Amazon invested $800 million on COVID-19 safety measures in the first half of the year.', 'Amazon fired a worker who helped to pass along to workers during peak times.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Delphi website includes a disclaimer stating that it is currently in beta and should not be used for advice or to aid in social understanding of humans.', 'The team added a later disclaimer to the website stating that the AI simply guesses what an average American might think of a given situation.', 'Co-author Liwei Jiang publicly told Futurism that Delphi is a research prototype not built to give people advice and is meant to investigate how AI systems can understand social norms and ethics.']

mitigation_taken: ["Google Maps' team is working to update routes in the Lake Tahoe area using details from local authorities.", 'Google Maps is showing a winter storm warning to alert drivers in the Lake Tahoe area.', 'Google Maps added road closure warnings (red dots with dashes) on the road Ms. Becktold had taken.', 'Waze Community Map Editors continued to keep Waze maps updated with the latest real-time routing information during the storm.', 'Waze issued a statement encouraging drivers to exercise caution and stay alert on the road.', "The Washoe County Sheriff's Office rescued the stranded family from the snowbound dirt road.", "The Washoe County Sheriff's Office posted on Facebook about the rescue and warned drivers that GPS had led them to ignore illuminated warning signs.", "The Washoe County Sheriff's Office issued a public warning that drivers had frequently taken the same detour when using GPS.", 'Caltrans communicated to the public that people should stay on highways and find alternate routes via highways rather than using rural roads.', 'Caltrans recommended that people stay put and wait until interstate or highway closures had been lifted.', 'A local worker in a safety vest waved drivers off the closed road to prevent them from continuing.']

mitigation_taken: ["A bipartisan group of House members sent a letter to Amazon CEO Andy Jassy demanding an accounting of the company's sales of sodium nitrite, details on related suicides, explanations of how the retailer had addressed the dangers, and how it had responded to complaints.", 'Members of Congress sought briefings from Google and other tech companies that help make the suicide website accessible.', 'Members of Congress asked Attorney General Merrick B. Garland to consider ways to prosecute the operators of the suicide website.', "Brian Huseman, Amazon's vice president for public policy, sent a written response to the lawmakers extending condolences to families and defending Amazon's practices and sales of the compound.", 'eBay prohibited global sales of the compound in 2019 after receiving a report of its potential use in suicides.', "An eBay director wrote to an English coroner acknowledging that sellers could circumvent eBay's policies and filters.", 'In the same letter, the eBay director stated that the company would support government restrictions on online sales of the chemical to prevent future suicides.', 'Etsy banned sales of the compound in November 2020.', 'Dr. Kyle Pires published an article in Clinical Toxicology encouraging emergency rooms to stock doses of the antidote methylene blue.', 'Coroners in the United Kingdom highlighted suicides involving online purchases of the preservative and asked the government to take action.', 'A cross-government group in the United Kingdom began working with manufacturers and online suppliers to reduce access to the compound and end some sales to individuals.', 'Metalchem, a British vendor, stopped selling the compound to the public in April 2020.', "Metalchem's chief executive notified an English coroner that he had asked other businesses to stop selling the compound online when the reason for the purchase could not be reasonably ascertained.", "Lawyers for Ruth Scott wrote to Amazon's general counsel and implored the company to remove the product from its platform.", 'An Amazon customer service representative replied to Ruth Scott that her message would be passed along.', 'Lawyers for Amazon pointed to a Texas law and court decisions protecting sellers of legal products used in suicides in response to requests to remove the product.']

mitigation_taken: ['Platforms notified reporters that the reported post or account violated the rules.', 'Platforms notified reporters that the reported content did not violate the rules.', 'Platforms sent reporters a confirmation that their report had been received.', 'Facebook reviewed the vast majority of reports within 24 hours.', 'Facebook used community reporting, human review, and automation to process reports.', 'Social networks proactively removed hateful or violating content themselves.', 'Facebook proactively detected and removed hate speech content, reporting that about 95% of hate speech content they remove is proactively detected today.', 'Facebook used AI to take action on straightforward cases and prioritized more nuanced cases for human reviewers.', 'Facebook published a Community Standards Enforcement Report on a quarterly basis.', 'Facebook blocked the profile of Bosnian journalist Dragan Bursac for 24 hours after determining his post violated community standards.', 'Both Twitter and Facebook provided an appeals process for suspended or blocked accounts.', 'Between January and October 2020, Facebook restored approximately 50,000 items of content without an appeal.', 'Between January and October 2020, Facebook restored 613,000 items of content after appeals.', 'In the first six months of 2020, Twitter suspended 925,744 accounts, including 127,954 flagged for hateful conduct and 72,139 for abuse/harassment.', 'Twitter removed violating content in a little over 1.9 million cases, including 955,212 in the hateful conduct category and 609,253 in the abuse/harassment category.', 'Companies like Facebook have been sued and, after losing, paid damages related to oversight of violent content.']

mitigation_taken: ['PULSE’s creators posted on GitHub acknowledging that PULSE produced white faces more frequently and attributing the bias likely to StyleGAN’s training dataset.', 'Mario Klingemann experimented with a different search method by starting gradient descent from different random locations in StyleGAN’s latent space to generate more non-white outputs from the same pixelated Obama image.', 'Yann LeCun tweeted that machine learning systems are biased when data is biased and argued that this sort of bias is more serious in deployed products than in academic papers.', 'Yann LeCun later acknowledged in a subsequent Twitter thread that there were multiple causes for AI bias.', 'When contacted by The Verge, Yann LeCun provided additional comments noting that he had helped set up groups inside and outside Facebook focusing on AI fairness and safety, including the Partnership on AI.', 'The Verge updated the article to include additional comment from Yann LeCun.', 'Deborah Raji publicly criticized the negligence of not testing for people of color and highlighted the lack of diversity among those who build AI systems.']

mitigation_taken: ['A major Swedish hospital reported that 37 of the 668 women who had sought an abortion between September and December 2017 were using Natural Cycles as their sole birth control.', 'The Medical Products Agency of Sweden began an investigation into Natural Cycles following reports of unwanted pregnancies.', "Natural Cycles' certification as contraception is under review in Sweden.", "Sweden's medical watchdog entered a second phase of its investigation and began reviewing the app's marketing material.", "Sweden's medical watchdog began reviewing Natural Cycles' past clinical studies as part of its investigation.", "Sweden's medical watchdog began reviewing fresh user data as part of its investigation.", 'Natural Cycles publicly responded that the number of pregnancies was proportional to the registered number of Swedish users and "in line with our expectations."', "Natural Cycles stated that it has evolved its messaging about the product, acknowledging that it previously presented the 93% figure without sufficient context.", 'A Natural Cycles customer service manager told a user she could cancel her subscription and reactivate it later when asked for a break for emotional wellbeing.', 'A Natural Cycles customer service manager reassured a user that the company never deletes any user data.']

mitigation_taken: ['Facebook hired dozens more Burmese speakers to review hate speech posted in Myanmar.', 'Facebook removed derogatory posts after Reuters alerted the company to them.', "Facebook removed threats posted against Reuters reporters at the news agency's request.", 'Mark Zuckerberg apologized to Phandeeyar and five other Myanmar groups.', 'Facebook banned several hate figures and organizations on its platform in Myanmar.', 'Accenture began to hire more Burmese speakers for the Honey Badger content-monitoring project.', 'Facebook introduced a Burmese-language interface with help from volunteer translators.', "Facebook's Honey Badger operation staffed about 60 people to review reports of hate speech and other content as of June.", 'Facebook published its internal community standards enforcement guidelines for the first time in April.', "Facebook's translations team said it was actively working on new ways to ensure that translations are accurate.", 'Facebook agreed to a process that allowed the Myanmar government to report fake news via email and have Facebook take down pages after verification.', 'Twitter removed a number of tweets that Reuters flagged to it.', 'Facebook removed a Facebook page that advocated genocide of Muslims after activists provided specific examples.', "Facebook took down a photograph and the accompanying comment calling an aid worker 'a traitor to the nation' after multiple complaints by activists."]
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; Training & Supportive Measures; Third-Party System Access; Governance Disclosure; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ["Ocado announced via Twitter that it would be canceling some orders due to a 'major incident.'", "Ocado canceled some customers' orders.", 'Ocado released a statement disclosing that a fire had erupted at its Erith Customer Fulfillment Centre.', 'Ocado evacuated over 800 employees from the facility.', 'Ocado contained the damage to less than 1 percent of the grid using its fire attenuation measures.', 'Ocado promised via Twitter to contact customers whose orders would be impacted as soon as possible.', 'The vast majority of customer orders were being fulfilled in other parts of the Ocado network.']

conditions to some deals limiting the use of its technology.", "Microsoft's internal ethics board trained Microsoft sales teams on applications of AI the company is wary of.", 'Microsoft helped improve a cloud service for analyzing faces after a research paper revealed it was much less accurate for black women than white men.', 'Facebook created an automatic adviser called Fairness Flow that measures how machine-learning software performs on different categories to help expose potential biases.', "Fairness Flow's feedback helped Facebook engineers choose job recommendation algorithms that worked better for different kinds of people.", 'Facebook is working on building Fairness Flow and similar tools into the machine-learning platform used company-wide.', 'Google promised that its new hyperrealistic voice assistant would identify itself as a bot when speaking with humans on the phone.', 'Google welcomed feedback on Duplex as it is refined into a product.', 'Google engaged in a broad internal discussion about military uses of machine learning.', 'Google is working on a set of principles that will guide the use of its technology.', 'Google\'s photo-organizing service was reprogrammed not to tag photos with "monkey" or "chimp" after a 2015 incident in which images of black people were tagged "gorilla."', 'Axon announced an ethics board of external experts to review ideas such as using AI in policing products like body cameras.', "Axon's ethics board will meet quarterly.", "Axon's ethics board will publish one or more reports a year.", "Axon's ethics board includes a member designated as a point of contact for Axon employees concerned about specific work.", 'Axon said it was looking at having the board take input from a wider range of people.', 'Tesla collects and analyzes safety and crash data from its vehicles.', 'Tesla owners can use voice commands to provide additional feedback to the company.']

mitigation_taken: ['A court ordered METRO to immediately suspend the process of capturing and processing biometric data for facial recognition as part of the electronic surveillance system.', 'The court ordered METRO to immediately suspend the roll-out of new equipment that enables data capture and biometric processing for facial recognition.', "The court's decision imposes a daily fine for non-compliance with the suspension order.", "METRO said it will appeal the decision and provide clarifications regarding the monitoring system's compliance with data protection regulations."]

mitigation_taken: ['The U.S. Department of Education opened an investigation in April into the data-sharing arrangement between Pasco County Schools and the Pasco Sheriff’s Office.', 'In early May the Pasco Sheriff’s Office and the school board revised their data-sharing agreement so school resource officers would no longer have access to student grades.', 'In early May the Pasco Sheriff’s Office and the school board revised their data-sharing agreement so school resource officers would no longer have access to student discipline histories.', 'In early May the Pasco Sheriff’s Office and the school board revised their data-sharing agreement so school resource officers would no longer have access to the school district’s early warning system.', 'The Pasco Sheriff’s Office released a lengthy public statement responding to reporting on the program.', 'A coalition of 30 advocacy groups called the PASCO Coalition issued a statement calling for the immediate termination of the student data-sharing arrangement.', 'The St. Paul collaborative program to develop a triage referral system and share data was halted in less than a year.', 'The American Civil Liberties Union sued Riverside County over its voluntary probation program.', 'After being sued by the ACLU, Riverside County stopped using the voluntary probation program that designated young people as at risk.', 'The Tampa Bay Times disclosed the existence of the Pasco County intelligence-led policing program in late 2020.']
assigned_subcategories: Data Governance; Access Management; Incident Investigation; System & Feature Restrictions; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['The Stanford researchers alerted LinkedIn about the profiles they discovered.', 'The Stanford researchers scoured LinkedIn and identified more than 1,000 accounts that appeared to be fake.', 'NPR contacted 28 universities about 57 of the profiles.', 'NPR attempted to contact more than a dozen companies listed as employers on profiles identified by the Stanford researchers.', 'LinkedIn investigated the reported profiles and removed those that broke its policies against fake profiles or falsifying information.', 'LinkedIn removed most of the profiles identified by the Stanford researchers.', 'LinkedIn removed the pages of the lead-generation company LIA.', 'LinkedIn removed the pages of the lead-generation company Vendisys.', 'LinkedIn said it is constantly updating its technical defenses to better identify and remove fake profiles and computer-generated images.', 'RingCentral said it is taking specific steps to update its approach to lead generation.', 'RingCentral said it will educate its people on what is and is not acceptable in terms of how the company communicates with customers and partners.', "Bob's Containers stopped working with the vendor airSales.", 'Renova Digital removed the description of its services and pricing from its website after NPR asked about them.', "Renova Digital's founder said he had tested AI-generated photos in the past but has stopped doing so.", "LIA's website was scrubbed of all information except its logo."]

mitigation_taken: ['The Chief Judge and other senior judges held a press conference to discuss and publicly address the use of AI in sentencing.', 'The judiciary stated that defendants will be informed of possible AI-generated sentence recommendations before a judge reaches a decision, giving them the chance to change their plea.', 'The judiciary plans to expand the AI system for use in civil motor-accident damages cases within three to six months.', 'The AI system will be used in Sabah and Sarawak courts to assist judges and save time in referring to past cases.', 'The judiciary said that, before going to trial, both sides will be able to know AI-estimated awards of damages so lawyers can negotiate settlements before coming to court.']

mitigation_taken: ['The telco set up a new project to fix the bot while it remained in operation.', 'The company continued to run the service with the malfunctioning bot and paid for its ongoing operation.', "The telco ran a large-scale fix-up project that lasted more than a year to address the bot's problems.", 'The company decided not to fix the problem from its roots and instead kept operating the flawed system.']

mitigation_taken: ['Tinder agreed to a settlement of US$24 million in a class-action age discrimination lawsuit in California in 2019.', 'Consumer International partnered with the Mozilla Foundation to adapt CHOICE’s methodology.', 'Consumer International and the Mozilla Foundation conducted fieldwork in six countries (New Zealand, the USA, the Netherlands, the Republic of Korea, India, and Brazil) between May and September 2021.', 'The investigators asked mystery shoppers to share a screenshot of the information provided upon registration.', 'The investigators asked mystery shoppers to provide their postal code.', 'The investigators asked mystery shoppers to share a screenshot of the price quoted for a one-month subscription to Tinder Plus.', 'Participants were instructed to sign up using their phone number rather than through email or social media accounts.', 'The study recruited 96 mystery shoppers in each country with quotas set based on gender, sexual preference, age, and location.', 'The investigators surveyed the same mystery shoppers with three questions about personalised pricing and asked them to select all applicable answers from a list of options.', 'The report states that Section 4 addresses limitations of the study and suggests potential avenues for further investigation.']
assigned_subcategories: Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Testing & Auditing

mitigation_taken: ['Democratic Party officials publicly blasted AI Yoon, calling the deepfake fraudulent and a threat to democracy.', 'The Democratic Party produced an AI version of Lee Jae-myung that was made from real footage of his actual comments.', 'Mr. Yoon’s campaign pivoted to fielding lighter voter questions and injecting humor into AI Yoon videos after the avatar’s initial launch performed poorly.', 'Mr. Yoon adapted what he brings up on the campaign trail and how he says it based on the popularity of the online AI videos.', 'The AI Yoon campaign team changed its scripting approach to make each response funny and understandable to a middle schooler.']

mitigation_taken: ['WeChat apologized for the inappropriate translation.', "After receiving users' feedback, WeChat immediately fixed the problem.", 'A WeChat spokesperson explained that the app used neural machine translation and that the engine was constantly being refined to provide more accurate, faithful, expressive, and elegant results.', "That's Shanghai reported the story.", "That's Shanghai found that the translator gave neutral translations in some instances but used the slur when the phrase included a negative term.", 'Sixth Tone conducted its own testing on Wednesday evening and found similar results.', 'Dove apologized for a similar gaffe.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Turing Institute held a series of workshops in late 2020 to discuss the role of AI in the covid response.', 'The Turing Institute published a report in June summarizing discussions from those workshops.', 'Laure Wynants and colleagues published and continue to update a review in the British Medical Journal assessing 232 predictive algorithms for diagnosing or predicting covid outcomes.', 'Derek Driggs and colleagues published a large review in Nature Machine Intelligence assessing 415 published deep-learning models for covid diagnosis and risk prediction.', 'Driggs’s research group trained its own model on a mixed-position chest scan data set to demonstrate how scan position can confound model predictions.', 'Laure Wynants requested that a company marketing deep-learning algorithms share information about its approach.', "Leading scientific groups from G7 participating nations issued a call for 'data readiness' in preparation for future health emergencies.", 'The World Health Organization began considering an emergency data-sharing contract to ease cross-border data movement during international health crises.']

mitigation_taken: ['CHOICE sent a list of detailed questions to Airbnb Australia seeking information about the way its algorithm is being used in the country.', "Airbnb responded to CHOICE with a public statement saying the safety, security and privacy of its community is a top priority and that its platform security and safety measures are designed to help ensure stays are safe and protect users' information.", 'When Renae Macheda queried her ban, Airbnb sent her a brief email stating that her account would be removed, she would not be able to create another one, and that they could not offer additional support on the matter.', "Airbnb emailed Rick Andrews to say his account had been flagged during a 'standard security review' and was linked to online ads for adult services that violate its Terms of Service.", 'CHOICE submitted to the Privacy Act review supporting the adoption of the EU framework, including an outright ban on social scoring algorithms and regulation of other high-risk uses of automated decision-making.', 'CHOICE is pushing for better consumer protections around automated decision-making, including informing consumers of the risks and offering avenues to opt out or review decisions.', 'Airbnb claims it offers users an opportunity to have automated decisions reviewed.']

mitigation_taken: ["Euler Hermes covered the entire amount of the victim company's claim.", 'A police investigation into the case has ended.', 'The U.K. executive became suspicious when a later caller used an Austrian phone number and did not make the second payment.', 'Euler Hermes declined to name the victim companies.', 'Mr. Kirsch recorded his own voice using a commercial voice-generating product and said the reproduced version sounded real.', 'Cybersecurity companies have recently developed products to detect so-called deepfake recordings.', 'The U.N. centre is researching technologies to detect fake videos.']

mitigation_taken: ['The police implemented a new VioGén protocol (VPR5.0-H) in March 2019.', 'The VioGén program was updated to identify cases of special relevance and cases with minors at risk.', 'VPR5.0-H introduced a dual evaluation procedure that carries out two parallel calculations, including a lethal-assault (H-scale) assessment.', 'The system was changed so that the risk score can be automatically increased based on the H-scale outcome.', 'Under the new protocol, cases can be signaled to prosecutors and judges as being of special relevance.', "Police agents can manually increase a case's risk score by hand if they assess a higher risk.", "Once a case's score is established, the agent assigns a packet of protection measures associated with that risk level.", 'For the lowest risk scores, agents discreetly check on the woman from time to time.', 'For the highest risk cases, the police provide the victim with an alarm button.', "For the highest risk cases, the police track the aggressor's movements.", "For the highest risk cases, the police can guard the victim's house.", "The agent sends the VioGén form and risk score to the prosecutors and judges handling the woman's case.", 'After the first report, police meet again with the woman to fill in a second form to reassess whether the situation has worsened or improved.', 'The police periodically reassess and follow up on cases until women are considered safe, stopping follow-up only if judicial measures are not pursued and the risk level falls below medium.', 'Police applied a control wristband to a high-risk aggressor in at least one case.', "Police broke into a victim's house after a wristband signal indicated the aggressor was moving toward the home, preventing an attack."]
assigned_subcategories: Risk Management; Safety Decision Frameworks; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Incident Response & Recovery; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['Tesla said a software update would fix the issues with its heat pumps.', 'Tesla released a software update that was supposed to prevent its vehicles from crashing against emergency vehicles.', 'Tesla attempted to dismiss an NHTSA investigation into Autopilot crashes involving emergency vehicles by issuing another over-the-air software update.', 'The road engineer at the scene placed crash warning signs before the crashed Tesla to protect the middle lanes as soon as possible.']

mitigation_taken: ["OpenAI researchers tried filtering out sexual content from DALL-E 2's training data.", 'OpenAI invited 23 external researchers to "red team" DALL-E 2.', 'OpenAI limited the initial release of DALL-E 2 to about 400 trusted users.', "OpenAI restricted DALL-E 2's available use for those users to non-commercial purposes.", 'OpenAI published a "Risks and Limitations" document for DALL-E 2.', "OpenAI published a model card documenting DALL-E 2's risks.", "OpenAI has been transparent and upfront with users about DALL-E 2's remaining limitations."]

mitigation_taken: ["Some states now require NarxCare to mark veterinary prescriptions with a paw print or animal icon on health providers' screens to help identify pet medications.", 'Appriss sent an emailed response to WIRED stating that the Overdose Risk Score is based solely on data from state prescription drug monitoring programs and does not use additional data sources.', "Appriss told WIRED that NarxCare's scores do not include any diagnosis information from patient medical records.", 'Appriss told WIRED that NarxCare does not take into account the distance a patient travels to receive medical care.', 'Appriss presented new data at a webinar showing that implementation of NarxCare sped up the decline in opioid prescribing in six states by about 10 percent.', "Appriss said it is actively looking for additional outcome data sets to study NarxCare's real-world effects on patients' lives.", "Appriss issued a public statement advising that its scores are intended as indicators to prompt further review of a patient's prescription history and are not meant to be sole determinants of patient risk.", 'Kathryn began trying to clear her NarxCare record after discovering she had been flagged.', 'Ryan Ward contacted Appriss directly in an attempt to get his high Overdose Risk Score fixed.', 'Ryan Ward approached a Publix pharmacist, showed his LinkedIn page, described the problem caused by his high score, and the pharmacist agreed to fill his buprenorphine prescription.', "Beverly Schechtman joined the advocacy group Don't Punish Pain Rally to campaign against unfair denial of opioid treatment.", "Angela Kilby reverse-engineered and simulated a NarxCare-style machine-learning model using de-identified health insurance claims data to evaluate the algorithm's predictive performance.", "Jennifer Oliva published the paper 'Dosing Discrimination' arguing that FDA approval should be mandatory for algorithms like NarxCare.", 'Appriss stated that its algorithm focuses on mitigation_taken: ['SN Technologies implemented a human-in-the-loop process requiring a human to verify each alert before it is confirmed.', 'SN Technologies trained the AEGIS system to recognize broom handles to prevent them from being misidentified as weapons.', 'The weapons detection aspect of the AEGIS system was recalibrated several times.', 'SN Technologies repeatedly tweaked and adjusted the system settings and camera installations, including after construction disturbed cameras, to restore full functionality.', "The Lockport City School District hired the accounting firm Freed Maxick to audit SN Technologies' accuracy and racial bias claims.", 'SN Technologies paid for the Freed Maxick independent review of its software and the NIST report interpretation.', 'Lockport parents Jim Shultz and Renee Cheatham filed a lawsuit against the New York State Education Department seeking to ban facial recognition in schools.', 'The New York legislature passed a bill that would ban the use of facial recognition in schools until a comprehensive study of its effect on students is completed.', 'Motherboard obtained emails and documents through Freedom of Information Law requests as part of its reporting.', 'SN Technologies sent a letter to Motherboard after publication providing further information about its technology.', 'The New York Civil Liberties Union is representing the Lockport parents in their lawsuit.', 'The NYCLU conducted an analysis of Smart Schools applications showing at least 11 other districts applied for funds to purchase facial recognition systems.']

mitigation_taken: ["On April 15, after NBC News contacted the company, Ever updated its privacy policy on the app's website to add clearer disclosure that some technologies may be used in separate enterprise products and services, including enterprise face recognition offerings, while stating that users' files and personal information will not be used in those enterprise offerings.", "On April 30, after further correspondence with NBC News, Ever added a new in-app pop-up feature that gives users an easy way to opt out of having their images used in the app's facial recognition tool.", 'Ever made the in-product opt-out feature available to all Ever users globally, expanding it beyond the geographic regions where it had previously been available, whether legally required or not.']

mitigation_taken: ["ByteDance spokesperson Jennifer Banks told BuzzFeed News that Flipagram and Vigo ceased operations years ago and aren't connected to any current ByteDance products.", 'Flipagram employees were instructed to delete offending accounts that impersonated creators.', 'Flipagram employees were instructed to give complaining creators control over accounts that had impersonated them.', 'Flipagram employees were instructed to tell complaining creators that Flipagram cannot prevent a user (or fan) from uploading someone else’s content.', 'According to an internal document, ByteDance capped video views from scraped content at a certain level so that scraped content views would not overwhelm content posted by real Flipagram users.', 'Flipagram limited how frequently it would recommend cross-posts to incentivize creators to post content first to Flipagram.', "BuzzFeed News sent ByteDance a comprehensive list of the allegations and a detailed set of questions, including whether data sets from Flipagram were ever used to train the 'For You' algorithm or any other ByteDance algorithms.", "Senator Richard Blumenthal called on regulators, including the FTC, to investigate ByteDance's alleged theft of data from Instagram and Snapchat users."]

mitigation_taken: ['Feminist activists and journalists led a grassroots audit of the AI system.', "Feminist activists quickly activated community organizing that brought national media attention to the system's misuse.", 'Feminist activists used media attention to enforce a measure of public accountability for the AI system.', "The Applied Artificial Intelligence Laboratory at the University of Buenos Aires highlighted the platform's serious technical and design errors.", 'The Applied Artificial Intelligence Laboratory at the University of Buenos Aires challenged the developers\' claim that the model made "correct predictions 98.2 percent of the time."', "It was publicly revealed that the Conin Foundation and Microsoft were behind the technology program.", 'Two technical reviews of the system were conducted.']

mitigation_taken: ['Tesla met with NHTSA on January 10, 2022, and January 19, 2022, to discuss the "rolling stop" functionality and its operating parameters.', 'Tesla voluntarily determined on January 20, 2022, to recall and disable the "rolling stop" functionality beginning with firmware release 2021.44.30.15 and newer releases.', 'Tesla will disable the "rolling stop" functionality on affected vehicles starting with firmware release 2021.44.30.15.', 'Tesla will begin deploying firmware release 2021.44.30.15 over-the-air to affected vehicles in early February 2022.', 'The disablement of the "rolling stop" functionality will be preserved in firmware release 2021.44.30.15 and later releases.', 'Owners who install firmware release 2021.44.30.15 or a later release will receive the remedy free of charge and need take no further action.', 'Tesla will notify all Tesla stores and service centers on or shortly after February 1, 2022.', 'Tesla will mail owner notification letters in accordance with 49 C.F.R. § 577.7 with a planned owner notification date of March 28, 2022.', 'Tesla does not plan to include a statement about pre-notice reimbursement in the Part 577 owner notification because there is no paid repair related to the recall condition.']

mitigation_taken: ['The government launched a nationwide identity reverification campaign forcing 180 million people to prove they were Pakistani.', 'NADRA sent text messages to the head of every registered household asking them to confirm the individuals on their family tree and to report any intruders.', "NADRA blocked or suspended CNICs ('digitally impounded') of individuals flagged during the reverification process.", 'NADRA charged each participating household 15 Pakistani rupees for the reverification process.', 'NADRA dismissed some lower-level functionaries following the Mansour incident.', 'Many suspended CNICs were reinstated after review.', 'NADRA set up registration sites across flooded areas to identify and assist those affected by the floods.', 'NADRA deployed vans fitted with equipment to retake fingerprints from people whose ID cards had been washed away.', 'NADRA reissued some 700,000 CNICs to flood-affected individuals.', 'NADRA distributed 77 billion Pakistani rupees to nearly three million families as flood relief.', 'NADRA issued ATM cards and opened temporary bank accounts enabling recipients to withdraw emergency aid.', "In 2014 NADRA relaxed the definition of 'parent' for orphans, allowing the head of an orphanage to become a child's legal guardian on records.", 'In 2017 NADRA clarified its policy for the khwaja sirah (trans or third gender) community by allowing community leaders to appear in place of a parent on a CNIC.', 'NADRA allowed members of the trans community to self-identify as a third gender on their CNICs and withdrew its initial medical-examination requirement.', 'A High Court judge ordered NADRA in 2017 to maintain a database of individuals belonging to the Ahmadi community and to provide details of people who officially changed their faith.', 'An anti-terrorism court ordered NADRA to block the CNICs of Manzoor Pashteen and Mohsin Dawar after they were declared absconding.', 'The Islamabad High Court ruled that NADRA does not have the authority to decide citizenship and that blocking CNICs while reviewing cases was illegal.', 'Upon his reinstatement, Tariq Malik fired 47 NADRA employees accused of facilitating fraudulent ID cards.', 'NADRA launched a new identity reverification campaign urging people to check for intruders in their family records amid concerns related to the Taliban takeover.', 'Authorities planned a new ID for foreign residents in Pakistan to allow them to open bank accounts and conduct business.', 'Following reports of a large data leak, the interior ministry and NADRA publicly denied responsibility for the breach.', 'NADRA officials served as first responders after the 2013 Balochistan earthquake by using their local offices and vehicles to assist.']

mitigation_taken: ['We took down the network of about 40 accounts, Pages, and Groups operating from Russia and Ukraine.', "We blocked the operation's domains from being shared on our platform.", 'We shared information about the operation with other tech platforms, researchers, and governments.', 'Our investigation into the operation is ongoing.', 'We found links between this network and another operation removed in April 2020 connected to individuals in Russia, the Donbass region of Ukraine, and two Crimea media organizations.', 'We detected attempts by the Ghostwriter threat actor to target people on Facebook.', 'We took steps to secure accounts that we believe were targeted by this threat actor.', 'When possible, we alerted users that they had been targeted by this threat actor.', 'We blocked phishing domains used by these hackers to try to trick people in Ukraine into compromising their online accounts.', 'We rolled out additional privacy and security protections in Ukraine.', 'We are adding the same additional privacy and security protections in Russia.', 'Our teams are working with civil society organizations to help ensure people know these security and privacy tools are available.', 'We temporarily removed the ability to view and search the friends lists of Facebook accounts.', 'On Instagram, we are sending everyone in Russia a notification at the top of feed about privacy and account security.', 'For public Instagram accounts, we are reminding people to check their settings in case they want to make their accounts private.', 'For people who already have private Instagram accounts, we are sharing tips on how to keep their accounts secure through strong passwords and two-factor authentication.', 'We continue to add measures to help protect people’s privacy and security.', 'We will share updates about these measures publicly.', 'We recommended that people in Ukraine and Russia take steps to strengthen the security of their online accounts.', 'We encourage people to use caution when accepting friend requests and opening links and files from people they don’t know.', 'We asked people to refrain from reusing the same passwords across different services.', 'We strongly recommended using two-factor authentication on all online accounts.']

mitigation_taken: ['Human Rights Watch released a 42-page report titled "[Video Unavailable\': Social Media Platforms Remove Evidence of War Crimes]".', 'Human Rights Watch urged all stakeholders to come together to develop an independent mechanism to preserve potential evidence of serious crimes.', 'Human Rights Watch urged that preserved content be made available to support national and international investigations, as well as research by nongovernmental organizations, journalists, and academics.', 'Human Rights Watch called on social media platforms to be more transparent about their existing takedown procedures and to provide meaningful opportunities to appeal content removal.', 'Human Rights Watch interviewed multiple civil society organizations, lawyers, archivists, journalists, former prosecutors, investigators, law enforcement officers, and officials as part of its investigation.', 'Human Rights Watch reviewed Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube content cited in its reports and identified 619 pieces of content that had been removed.', 'In May 2020, Human Rights Watch sent letters to Facebook, Twitter, and Google sharing links to removed content.', 'In those May 2020 letters, Human Rights Watch asked Facebook, Twitter, and Google if Human Rights Watch could regain access to the removed content for archival purposes.', 'Rights groups have been urging social media companies since 2017 to improve transparency and accountability around content takedowns.']

mitigation_taken: ['Mark filled out a form requesting a review of Google’s decision and explained his son’s infection.', 'Google disabled Mark’s account citing harmful content and a possible child sexual abuse & exploitation violation.', 'Google’s review team declined to reinstate Mark’s account.', 'Google searched Mark’s account for other exploitative material after the images were flagged.', 'Google made a report to the CyberTipline at the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children.', 'CyberTipline staff added any new abusive images to the hashed database shared with technology companies.', 'CyberTipline staff escalated potential new victims to law enforcement.', 'The San Francisco Police Department served search warrants on Google and Mark’s internet service provider requesting everything in his Google account.', 'The San Francisco police preserved the contents of Mark’s Google account on a thumb drive.', 'Investigator Nicholas Hillard determined that no crime occurred, closed the case, and sent Mark a letter informing him of the investigation and its closure.', 'Mark appealed his case to Google again and provided the police report.', 'Mark spoke with a lawyer about suing Google.', 'Mark’s wife deleted the photos Mark had taken of their son from her iPhone after learning the images could be added to the hashed database.', 'Cassio asked his mortgage broker to switch his email address after his Gmail account was disabled.', 'Cassio showed the detective his communications with the pediatrician, and he was quickly cleared.', 'Cassio began using a Hotmail address for email and started making multiple backups of his data.', 'Google issued a public statement saying that child sexual abuse material is abhorrent and that the company is committed to preventing its spread.', 'A police spokesman said the San Francisco Police Department is eager to help Mark obtain a copy of the preserved account contents.']

mitigation_taken: ['Tens of thousands of commenters posted positive messages on Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho, and Bukayo Saka’s Facebook and Instagram pages to combat the racist attacks.', 'Fans urged fellow supporters to report offensive comments to company moderators.', 'Many soccer fans reported racist posts to the social media companies where the posts appeared.', 'Twitter said it took down 1,000 posts in the 24 hours since the game.', 'Facebook quickly removed an unspecified number of comments and accounts directing abuse at England’s footballers.', 'Twitter used a combination of machine learning-based automation and human review to identify and proactively flag a majority of racist comments toward the players.', 'Facebook encouraged users experiencing harassment to turn on the "hidden words" feature to block designated words or emojis in comments on their posts.', 'England’s Secretary of State for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport tweeted that the new Online Safety Bill will hold social media companies to account with fines of up to 10 percent of global revenue if they fail to address such abuse.', 'Facebook said it will continue to take action against those that break its rules.']

mitigation_taken: ['Geisel opened an investigation into possible cheating after a faculty member reported possible cheating.', "The Committee on Student Performance and Conduct asked the school's technology staff to audit Canvas activity during 18 remote exams.", 'The technology staff reviewed more than 3,000 exams as part of the audit.', 'The technology staff developed a system to recognize online activity patterns that might signal cheating.', 'The audit identified 38 potential cheating cases.', 'The committee eliminated some flagged cases after determining a professor had directed students to use Canvas.', 'In mid-March emails, the committee sent the 17 accused students spreadsheets detailing the exam name, test question number, timestamps, and the names of Canvas pages showing activity.', 'Administrators provided accused students with the data on which the cheating charges were based.', 'The committee dismissed the charges against seven of the 17 accused students.', 'The committee dismissed charges against at least two students after they said the audit had misinterpreted automated Canvas activity as human activity.', 'The conduct review committee issued decisions in 10 cases expelling several students.', 'The conduct review committee suspended other students.', 'The conduct review committee required some students to retake courses.', 'The conduct review committee required some students to repeat a year of school.', 'Some accused students filed appeals of their disciplinary decisions.', "Dozens of students gathered in front of Dr. Compton's office to protest the investigation.", "More than two dozen members of Dartmouth's faculty wrote a letter to Dr. Compton saying the school should make amends with the students falsely accused.", 'Geisel administrators held a virtual forum to answer questions about the investigation.', "Dartmouth issued a social media policy warning that students' anonymous posts may still be traced back to them.", 'Dr. Compton apologized in an email for the handling of the cases and said the school was working to improve its procedures.', 'The medical school implemented new guidelines requiring students to log out of Canvas on all devices prior to testing.', 'School officials hired a legal consulting firm to validate their analysis.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Testing & Auditing; User Rights & Recourse; Usage & Access Limitations; System Documentation

mitigation_taken: ['I clicked the advertisement to follow it.', 'I performed a reverse image search on the testimonial image and found it matched filmmaker Sam Muirhead.', 'I searched my Hunchly archive for Facebook URLs containing the keyword "sponsored" to find similar ads.', 'I viewed an archived Facebook ad page from December 11, 2015 in Hunchly and inspected the ad without clicking it.', "I moused over the ad to view the actual destination URL displayed in Chrome's status bar.", "I right-clicked and copied the ad's encoded URL into a text editor instead of clicking it.", 'I pasted the encoded URL into an online URL decoder to reveal the shortened Google URL.', 'I accessed the Google shortened URL\'s analytics by adding ".info" and reviewed its click counts and referrer data.', 'I investigated the dftrack6.com domain and found it appeared suspicious.', "I created a targeted Facebook ad with a mismatched display URL (cnn.com) and landing page (hunch.ly) to test Facebook's approval process.", 'I turned the test ad off immediately after it started running.', 'I asked readers to email me their findings so I could collect statistics and encourage further investigations.']

mitigation_taken: ['Nijeer Parks filed a lawsuit against the police, the prosecutor, and the City of Woodbridge alleging false arrest, false imprisonment, and violation of his civil rights.', 'In November 2019, the case against Mr. Parks was dismissed for lack of evidence.', 'New Jersey Attorney General Gurbir S. Grewal put a moratorium on Clearview AI’s use by the police.', 'The attorney general announced an investigation into Clearview AI or products like it.', 'New Jersey’s Division of Criminal Justice was evaluating the use of facial recognition products in the state.', 'The development of a policy governing the use of facial recognition products in New Jersey was ongoing.', 'Mr. Parks’s mother and fiancée hired an attorney to represent him.', 'That attorney got Mr. Parks out of jail and into a pretrial monitoring program.', 'Mr. Parks obtained Western Union records showing he was sending money at a pharmacy in Haledon, New Jersey, at the time of the incident.', 'Mr. Parks told the judge he was willing to go to trial to defend himself.', 'The New York State Intelligence Center and New Jersey’s Regional Operations Intelligence Center said they did not make the facial recognition match.', 'Clearview AI’s founder stated that officers affiliated with the state agencies and fusion centers were not using his company’s app at that time.']

mitigation_taken: ['Jisuk Mok went to the Frisco Police Department to file a police report.', 'Jisuk Mok reached out to the city of Frisco to ask questions about the incident.', 'Jisuk Mok filed a claim with her insurance company.', 'Jisuk Mok turned to NBC 5 Responds for help.', 'NBC 5 Responds submitted an open records request to learn about other accidents at the intersection.', 'NBC 5 contacted both the city of Frisco and Starship Technologies asking about the accidents and why the robots do not have a phone number listed.', 'Starship Technologies told Mok they would send her the video of the accident.', 'Starship Technologies provided an email response to NBC 5’s questions explaining their deployment and indicating that their website and contact information are written on the robots.', "Starship Technologies agreed to pay more than $2,600 to cover the damages to Mok's car.", 'Starship Technologies pulled out of Frisco on August 7.', 'Starship Technologies moved its robots back to The University of Texas at Dallas.']

mitigation_taken: ['The matter was referred to the dean of student affairs.', 'The student met with the dean and the professor by video to discuss the flagged behavior.', 'The student was found responsible for noncompliance and received a zero on the exam.', "A warning was placed on the student's academic record.", "Honorlock's live proctors investigated and discovered that Rekognition was mistakenly registering faces in photos or posters as additional people in the room.", "When Rekognition mistakenly registered faces in photos or posters, Honorlock told Amazon's engineers.", "Amazon's engineers took Honorlock's real data and used it to improve their AI.", 'Honorlock uses human employees as live proctors who pop in by chat when there is a high number of flags on an exam.', 'ProctorU discontinued offering an AI-only product that flagged videos for professors to review.', "ProctorU changed its process so that all suspicious behavior is now reviewed by one of the company's approximately 1,300 proctors.", 'ProctorU required its contractors to undergo rigorous training to review flagged videos.', 'ProctorU instructed its proctors to confirm a breach only if there was solid evidence that a test taker was receiving help.']

mitigation_taken: ["Murat Ayfer updated Philosopher AI's content filter so more prompts return the polite response: 'Philosopher AI is not providing a response for this topic, because we know this system has a tendency to discuss some topics using unsafe and insensitive language.'", 'Murat Ayfer added a function that lets users report offensive responses in Philosopher AI.', 'OpenAI launched GPT-3 as a private closed beta with carefully selected users to develop applications under company oversight.', 'OpenAI created an internal team that vets proposed applications for GPT-3.', 'OpenAI provides safety guidelines to companies granted access to the GPT-3 API.', 'OpenAI reviews applications again before deployment of GPT-3-powered products.', 'OpenAI monitors the use of GPT-3 after deployment.', 'OpenAI offers a general content filter for harmful bias and toxic language.', 'OpenAI is developing tools to help users better control GPT-3’s generated text.', "OpenAI provides mechanisms (such as prompting guidance and temperature settings) to influence GPT-3's tone and riskiness of output.", 'OpenAI maintains an internal red team that actively tries to break the model and find harmful behaviors.', "OpenAI researchers analyze the model's underlying weights to try to identify indicators associated with harmful content.", "OpenAI's review team has rejected applicants whose proposed products are deemed too sensitive.", 'OpenAI has insisted on a human-in-the-loop for some applications, requiring AI-generated text to be reviewed by a human before reaching end users.', 'OpenAI has stated it will not broadly expand access to GPT-3 until it is confident it has a handle on safety issues.', 'OpenAI initially withheld the full GPT-2 model and instead released a downsized version to mitigate misuse risks.', 'The Allen Institute for AI created the RealToxicityPrompts dataset of 100,000 prompts to evaluate toxicity in language-model outputs.', 'AI2 researchers applied additional training with innocuous text as a mitigation strategy to try to detoxify model outputs.', 'AI2 researchers applied filtering of generated text by scanning for keywords and by using more sophisticated filtering methods as a mitigation strategy.', "Art of Problem Solving ensures GPT-3's generated text never goes directly to students by routing AI outputs through human graders who check and customize responses.", 'Sapling Intelligence constrained its use of GPT-3 by avoiding freeform generation and limiting the technology to protective, bounded tasks.', 'Koko uses a human-collaboration approach where GPT-3 generates bot-written responses or suggested text that human respondents can modify.', 'Replika has GPT-3 generate multiple response options and uses custom classifiers to detect and filter responses with negativity, harmful bias, and abusive language.', 'Replika collects user labels for inappropriate responses and uses that feedback as training data to improve its classifiers.', 'Latitude provides a default safe mode for AI Dungeon that relies on a combination of filters and prompt engineering, and requires users to explicitly turn off safety mode to access less-restrained content.', "Latitude built its own screening technology rather than relying solely on OpenAI's safety filter so safety can be tailored to game context."]

mitigation_taken: ['The European Commission fined Google €2.4 billion in 2017 for favoring its own comparison shopping service.', "The EU General Court in Luxembourg ruled to uphold the European Commission's 2017 €2.4 billion fine against Google.", 'Margrethe Vestager fined Google €4.34 billion in 2018 over its Android operating system.', 'Margrethe Vestager fined Google €1.49 billion in 2019 over advertising on other websites.', "In June, Vestager opened a new probe into Google's online advertising practices.", 'U.S. authorities opened three fresh antitrust cases against Google over the past year.', 'Google said it will review the court decision closely.', "Google said it made changes in 2017 to comply with the European Commission's decision to give shopping comparison rivals equal treatment.", "Google said it already complies with the order contained in the Commission's 2017 decision to give shopping comparison rivals equal treatment.", "Google's rivals are seeking compensation through damages cases against Google.", 'The comparison shopping services that complained to the Commission are seeking to increase their demands on the Commission to force Google to make more substantial changes.', 'The European Commission said it will continue to use all tools at its disposal to address the role of big digital platforms.']

mitigation_taken: ['Wanda Stokes apologized for the fiasco that led to false fraud accusations.', 'Wanda Stokes reassigned the director of the Unemployment Insurance Agency.', 'The state is reviewing about 50,000 fraud cases from a nearly two-year period covering roughly 40,000 people.', 'The state is reviewing 28,000 other cases from that time that were handled by the computers and staff.', 'The state made public a review of unemployment fraud cases in December that found a 93 percent error rate for about 22,000 cases.', 'On Jan. 11 the state agreed to halt all collection activities against people who were subject to fraud determinations in the period in question.', 'As part of that agreement, the state will individually review each halted case and affirm fraud determinations with new notice to claimants before resuming collection activities.', 'A new law prevents the agency from adjudicating a claimant’s case as fraud without human verification.', 'The new law reduces the statute of limitations for pursuing fraud from six years to three years.', 'Wanda Stokes said she plans to talk to legislators about enacting more reasonable penalties for unemployment fraud.', 'Legislators plan to propose more bills in the new two-year session as needed.', 'Senate Minority Leader Jim Ananich wants to create a fund to repay affected people and to address potential statute of limitations issues.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Testing & Auditing; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Incident Response & Recovery; Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies

mitigation_taken: ['RealPage agreed in 2018 to pay $3 million to settle an FTC complaint that it had failed to ensure accuracy in its tenant screening product.', "Property staff asked their company's division that oversaw YieldStar to review the software's recommendations.", 'The landlord subsequently raised rates more gradually after that internal review.', "Federal agents removed a computer and documents from Jeffrey Roper's office during an antitrust prosecution.", 'The government reached settlements or consent decrees with eight airlines in price-fixing cases.', 'Those airlines agreed to change how they used the pricing technology under the settlements or consent decrees.', 'In 2021, the Federal Trade Commission said it was seeking a more active role in enforcing competition rules in such cases.', 'Angry protesters disrupted the National Multifamily Housing Council conference by seizing the stage and recounting how their families had been harmed by lack of affordable housing.', 'RealPage issued an email stating that it uses aggregated market data from a variety of sources in a legally compliant manner.', "RealPage issued a statement claiming its revenue management solutions prioritize a property's internal supply and demand dynamics and therefore help eliminate the risk of collusion.", 'RealPage stated that its software helps prevent rents from reaching unaffordable levels by detecting drops in demand and responding by lowering rents.', 'RealPage said that using actual rents helps capture a truer picture of price elasticity and affordability, reducing the odds a unit is overpriced.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Portland family contacted Amazon to investigate the incident.', 'The family unplugged all of their Alexa devices.', 'Danielle listened to the recorded conversation after it was sent back to her.', 'Danielle repeatedly called Amazon.', 'An Alexa engineer investigated the incident.', "Amazon's engineers reviewed the family's device logs and confirmed the events the family reported.", 'The Alexa engineer apologized repeatedly to the family.', 'Amazon said it investigated the incident and determined it was an extremely rare occurrence.', 'Amazon stated it is taking steps to avoid this from happening in the future.', 'Amazon said it is evaluating options to make this case even less likely.', "Amazon offered to de-provision Danielle's Alexa communications so she could continue using Smart Home features."]

mitigation_taken: ['Weibo announced an effort to "clean up" the use of intentionally misspelled words and homophones.', 'Weibo said it would refine its "keyword identification model" to be able to filter coded language used to dodge censors.', 'A main Chinese internet regulator prohibited the use of intentionally misspelled words and homophones in usernames.', 'Baidu banned the popular insult from its message forums in 2021.', 'State media published stories defending China’s airborne forces in response to people calling each other paratroopers.', 'Baidu left posts using the word for paratrooper up despite knowing their intended insulting meaning.', 'The characters for "river crab" were banned on Chinese social media.', 'Most of the popular examples of censor-dodging online slang were eventually banned.', 'The Cyrillic character used in chrysanthemum script was unbanned and is no longer banned.', 'A giant inflatable green horse was placed in a public square in Wuhan and became a social media sensation.']
