mitigation_taken: ['A group of UK Uber drivers launched a legal action against Uber in the Netherlands supported by the App Drivers and Couriers Union, the International Alliance of App-based Transport Workers, and Worker Info Exchange.', 'Copies of the complaint filed at the Amsterdam district court were published in English and Dutch.', 'The drivers will argue in court that Uber violated its obligations under the GDPR by failing to provide full access to their personal data and sufficient information on automated decision making and profiling.', "The union will present evidence in court of Uber's maintenance of performance-related electronic tags attached to driver profiles.", 'The drivers will ask the district court in Amsterdam to order Uber to immediately comply with data protection law and to impose a €10,000 fine for each day it continues to violate the law.', "The drivers will ask the court to order Uber to respect their right to port personal data directly from Uber to their union's fledgling data trust.", 'The App Drivers and Couriers Union is working with Worker Info Exchange to establish a data trust for drivers for the purposes of collective bargaining.', 'The drivers will be represented in the Netherlands by their attorney Anton Ekker.', 'The union launched a CrowdJustice campaign to help fund the legal action.', 'The union called on all Uber drivers and Uber Eats couriers in the UK and the European Economic Area to register for free to join the collective action for digital rights.', 'The International Alliance of App-based Transport Workers provided support for the legal action, forming an international collaboration of Uber driver unions.']
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Data Governance; User Rights & Recourse; Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies

mitigation_taken: ['A court in Palm Beach County set a February date for a jury trial to hear testimony on who was at fault.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is conducting multipronged investigations into Autopilot and related crashes.', 'The NHTSA has investigated almost 200 crashes involving vehicles using the Autopilot feature.', "California's Department of Motor Vehicles accused Tesla of false advertising in August.", "California DMV officials interviewed former Tesla engineer Christopher 'CJ' Moore and concluded some of Elon Musk’s tweets exaggerated Autopilot’s capabilities.", 'The National Transportation Safety Board publicly chastised Tesla last October for failing to respond to its 2017 recommendations, including recommendations to limit where Autopilot can be activated and to ensure drivers pay attention while using the feature.', 'Some Tesla owners posted videos showing their vehicles safely stopping in front of real children in response to a viral YouTube video.', "The NHTSA issued a 'don't try this at home' warning following the viral YouTube video.", "A judge ruled that Elon Musk did not have to sit for a deposition, rejecting the Banners' argument that he has 'unique knowledge'.", 'The Banner family filed a lawsuit against Tesla.']

mitigation_taken: ['ProPublica contacted Facebook about the presence of anti‑Semitic ad categories.', 'Facebook removed the anti‑Semitic targeting categories and associated targeting fields.', 'Facebook said it would explore ways to fix the problem.', 'Facebook said it would limit the number of ad categories available.', 'Facebook said it would scrutinize ad categories before they are displayed to advertisers.', 'Facebook said it was building new guardrails in its product and review processes to prevent similar issues in the future.', 'Facebook looked at the use of the identified audiences and campaigns to determine how common or widespread they were.', 'After an earlier ProPublica article about discriminatory housing ads, Facebook built a system intended to prevent such ads from being approved.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Markup created a new Gmail account to test how the company filters political email.', 'The Markup used a new phone number and the Tor anonymizing browser to avoid sending signals about political leanings while conducting the test.', 'The Markup signed up for the email lists of 16 presidential candidates to see where their messages would be delivered.', 'The Markup also signed up for congressional candidates and advocacy groups, think tanks, and nonprofits from across the political spectrum.', 'Over four months, The Markup collected more than 5,000 emails from 171 groups as part of its testing.', 'The Markup reviewed email data provided by Democracy for America, CREDO Action, and SumOfUs to analyze Gmail open rates.', 'Change.org employees tested their own Gmail accounts and found that Change.org emails were being sent to the promotions tab.', "A coalition of eight progressive advocacy groups wrote a letter to Google in November 2018 complaining that Gmail's categorization impeded their ability to engage the public.", 'The coalition held a phone conversation with a Gmail official the following month to discuss the issue.', 'A Gmail official suggested that the groups could buy an ad in the promotions tab or offer a deal to get more eyeballs on their emails.', "Google communications manager Katie Wattie emailed that Gmail's categories help users organize their email and that mail classifications automatically adjust to match users' preferences and actions.", 'Google spokesperson Katie Wattie wrote in an email that Gmail has not allowed political content in ads since 2016, including issue advocacy and fund-raising.']

mitigation_taken: ['Detroit Police implemented a new policy governing the use of facial recognition software that includes stricter rules on when it can be used.', 'Detroit Police now use the facial recognition technology only as a tool to help solve violent felonies.', "A Detroit Police Department spokesman said he was looking into questions from the Free Press about Oliver's case.", "The Wayne County Prosecutor's Office implemented more stringent protocol for facial recognition cases.", 'Current protocol requires a supervisor to review all evidence in a facial recognition case prior to a charging decision.', 'Current protocol requires that there be other evidence corroborating the allegations before charging someone in a facial recognition case.', 'Facial recognition cases must be submitted to Prosecutor Kym Worthy for approval if an assistant prosecuting attorney and a supervisor determine charges should be authorized.', 'Prosecutors and police apologized for how the Williams case was handled.', 'Worthy stated that facial recognition cases will be reviewed during the warrant charging phase.', 'Worthy stated that facial recognition cases will be reviewed prior to the preliminary examination.', 'Worthy stated that facial recognition cases will be reviewed again when the case is bound over to the Circuit Court.', 'The Detroit police commission discussed the Williams case during a meeting.', 'Detroit police gave a presentation to the police commission about the Williams case.', 'Board member Evette Griffie sought answers from police about the Williams case, including a timeline of events and any discipline resulting from the misidentification.']

mitigation_taken: ['Amnesty International sued the NYPD after it refused to disclose public records regarding its acquisition of facial recognition technology and other surveillance tools.', 'Amnesty International launched a new interactive website that allows users to discover how much of a walking route between two locations in New York City might be exposed to facial recognition surveillance.', 'Thousands of digital volunteers crowdsourced data and mapped more than 25,500 CCTV cameras across New York City as part of the Decode Surveillance NYC project.', 'Amnesty International worked with data scientists to compare the crowdsourced CCTV data with statistics on stop-and-frisk and demographic data.', 'Amnesty International encourages New Yorkers to send a letter of protest to their council member demanding the introduction of a bill that prohibits facial recognition technology.', 'Amnesty International made a petition available for global users to sign calling for regulation of when and where public facial recognition systems are used.', 'Amnesty International is calling for a total ban on the use, development, production, sales, and export of facial recognition technology for mass surveillance by both states and the private sector.', 'Amnesty International conducted investigations into surveillance in New York and Hyderabad as part of its Ban The Scan campaign.', 'Amnesty International worked with research partners including Julien Cornebise, BetaNYC, and Dr Damon Wischik to carry out the research.']

mitigation_taken: ['The authors conducted an extraction attack to evaluate memorization in GPT-2 by interacting with the model as a black-box and generating many samples.', 'The authors generated a total of 600,000 samples by querying GPT-2 with three different sampling strategies.', 'The authors retained generated samples that had an abnormally high likelihood relative to a different language model.', 'The authors selected 1,800 samples with abnormally high likelihood for manual inspection.', 'The authors manually inspected those 1,800 high-likelihood samples and found 604 that contained text reproduced verbatim from the training set.', 'The authors published a paper and a BAIR blog post describing their extraction method, findings, and potential mitigations.']

mitigation_taken: ['Após o alerta do sistema de reconhecimento facial, Davi foi monitorado pelas câmeras por 15 estações, da Lapa à Mussurunga.', 'Uma guarnição policial abordou Davi no ponto de ônibus.', 'Os policiais compararam o RG de Davi com o seu rosto e com imagens em um aparelho celular durante a abordagem.', 'Os policiais constataram que ele não era o suspeito apontado pelo sistema e o liberaram.', 'A Secretaria de Segurança Pública afirmou que o sistema emite um alerta ao Centro Integrado de Telecomunicações quando detecta 90% de semelhança com um procurado.', 'Após esse alerta, é realizada uma análise humana para confirmar a semelhança detectada pelo algoritmo.', 'Se a análise humana confirmar a semelhança, uma guarnição policial mais próxima é acionada para realizar a abordagem.', 'A Polícia Militar finaliza a ação no local sem registro de ocorrência quando identifica que o sistema errou.', 'Policiais consultam informações de cidadãos usando o aplicativo Sistema de Mobilidade em Operações Policiais (MOP) instalado em aparelhos celulares, inclusive particulares.', 'A SSP respondeu a um pedido via Lei de Acesso à Informação esclarecendo o funcionamento do sistema e afirmando que, até o momento, o recurso é usado apenas para localizar pessoas desaparecidas e que imagens públicas de redes sociais podem ser utilizadas para investigação.']
assigned_subcategories: Safety Decision Frameworks; Incident Response & Recovery; Post-Deployment Monitoring; System Documentation

mitigation_taken: ["A draft law inspired by Molly's death is being advanced through Britain’s Parliament to force social media companies to adopt new child safety protections or risk heavy fines.", 'Instagram restricted access to some suicide and self-harm content.', 'Pinterest restricted access to some suicide and self-harm content.', 'Meta added new protections in 2019 prohibiting graphic images of self-harm such as cutting.', 'Meta added new protections in 2019 providing links to resources for users viewing sad or depressive material.', 'Meta agreed to provide more than 16,000 pages from Molly’s Instagram to investigators.', 'The London police bypassed Molly’s iPhone passcode and extracted 30,000 pages of material.', 'Thousands of images, videos and other social media material from Molly’s accounts were revealed during the investigation.', 'Mr. Russell went public with Molly’s story in January 2019.', 'The Russell family pursued the case as a form of justice and to raise awareness about youth suicide and the dangers of social media.', 'Mr. Russell urged the coroner to go beyond a formulaic process and to explore the role of social media in Molly’s death.', 'The coroner ruled that Instagram and other social media platforms had contributed to Molly’s death.', "The head of community operations at Pinterest publicly apologized and said he 'deeply regrets' that Molly had viewed explicit material.", 'Meta issued a public statement expressing condolences to the Russell family and saying it was committed to ensuring that Instagram is a positive experience for teenagers.']

mitigation_taken: ['Managers were required to use a tracking tool every shift to identify the "top offender" by scanner inactivity.', 'Managers were required to ask the top offender about their whereabouts for each timestamp registered as unproductive and discipline them when appropriate.', 'Managers were trained to write up the top offender per shift.', 'Managers could question at least three workers per shift about their whereabouts for periods registered as time off task.', 'Managers asked workers to explain each block of inactive scanner time recorded by the tool.', "Managers subtracted time from employees' TOT totals for justified reasons such as bathroom use and equipment issues.", "Managers used surveillance video footage to corroborate or disprove employees' alibis about their whereabouts.", "Managers were required to have a 'seek to understand' conversation with the top offender to determine barriers that might warrant deduction of time.", "Managers adjusted employees' total time off task based on those explanations.", 'Managers provided feedback and issued disciplinary write-ups when appropriate after reviewing TOT.', "If the top offender's TOT was found justified, managers were required to coach the employee with the second-highest TOT.", 'A proposed script was provided for managers to communicate TOT findings and policy violations to employees.', 'Workers received a first written warning for accumulating 30 to 59 minutes of TOT for the first time in a 12-month period.', 'Managers issued a final written warning when workers met specified TOT thresholds (60-119 minutes in a single day or repeated 30-59 minutes within 12 months).', 'Amazon terminated employees who accumulated two hours of TOT in a single shift or who had a final written warning plus 30 or more minutes of TOT within 12 months.', 'Motherboard obtained an internal list showing 18 JFK8 workers were terminated between Jan. 1, 2020 and Feb. 25, 2020 for accumulating more than two hours of TOT in a single day.', 'Morgan Lewis submitted the documents to the National Labor Relations Board in February 2020 to try to dismiss a charge alleging unlawful retaliation.', 'Morgan Lewis requested that the National Labor Relations Board treat the documents as confidential and not reveal contents without prior written consent.', 'Managers provided employees with minute-by-minute lists of inactive scanner times so the employees could explain periods of inactivity.', 'The documents were obtained via a public records request.']
assigned_subcategories: Post-Deployment Monitoring; Training & Supportive Measures; Incident Investigation; Risk Management; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['A Facebook spokesperson wrote via email that the company does not use information from third-party apps to show friend suggestions in People You May Know.', 'A Facebook spokesperson confirmed that People You May Know suggestions are not informed by smartphone Location Services.', "A Facebook spokesperson told the reporter there was an undocumented trick to stop appearing in People You May Know by switching the account setting 'Who can send you friend requests?' to 'No one.'", 'The day after the story was originally published, a Facebook spokesperson retracted the explanation about the opt-out workaround, saying the company had provided incorrect information about the workaround.', 'A Facebook spokesperson stated that the company has put safeguards in place to help users understand their privacy choices.', 'A Facebook spokesperson stated that the company has put safeguards in place to help users moderate comments.', 'A Facebook spokesperson stated that the company has put safeguards in place to help users block people.', 'A Facebook spokesperson stated that the company has put safeguards in place to help users control location sharing.', 'A Facebook spokesperson stated that the company has put safeguards in place to help users report abusive content.', "Facebook advised that users can 'X' out anyone who appears in People You May Know that they don't want to see.", 'Ela Darling searches Facebook every few weeks for last names of her family and extended family and blocks them when she finds them.', 'Ela Darling deleted her second private account under her legal name a few years ago, leaving only her public porn account.', "A sex toy reviewer advised that users can choose a profile photo that doesn't show their face to reduce the risk of being identified.", "After reading the story, a Facebook spokesperson acknowledged that the company 'fell short' and wrote that 'we will do better.'"]

mitigation_taken: ['Researchers from Microsoft, Recorded Future, the RAND Corporation, NewsGuard and the University of Maryland revealed and reported on the covert Chinese disinformation campaign about the Maui wildfires.', 'Microsoft’s researchers analyzed the covert campaign involving the Maui wildfires.', "Recorded Future reported that the Chinese government mounted a covert campaign to blame a 'weather weapon' for the fires.", 'Microsoft’s Threat Analysis Center identified inauthentic posts in 31 languages related to the campaign.', 'Microsoft’s researchers identified AI-generated images of the Hawaii wildfires appearing on multiple platforms.', 'Microsoft’s researchers reported that those specific AI-generated images appeared to be exclusively used by Chinese accounts in the campaign.', 'Caroline Amy Orr Bueno reported that a coordinated Russian campaign began on Twitter on Aug. 9 seeking to spread related narratives.', 'Brad Smith, Microsoft’s vice chairman and president, sharply criticized China for exploiting a natural disaster for political gain.', 'Brad Smith presented and was scheduled to present some of Microsoft’s findings to Congress.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['NewsGuard identified a network of 17 TikTok accounts apparently using AI text-to-speech technology and analyzed their videos, views, and likes.', "NewsGuard recreated the video's audio introduction using ElevenLabs' AI text-to-speech software and identified the likely voice as 'Natasha -- Valley Girl.'", "NewsGuard emailed ElevenLabs in September 2023 to ask whether the video was produced using ElevenLabs' software.", "A NewsGuard analyst entered the video's audio into ElevenLabs' AI speech classifier to assess whether it was generated by ElevenLabs.", "An ElevenLabs spokesperson directed NewsGuard to an AI speech classifier available on ElevenLabs' website.", "ElevenLabs' AI speech classifier analyzed the audio and reported that it was '98%... very likely' generated with ElevenLabs.", 'TikTok unveiled a feature on Sept. 19, 2023 allowing users to place disclosure labels on content they produced with the help of AI.', "TikTok directed NewsGuard to the platform's policies on misinformation and manipulated media.", "TikTok removed three of the identified accounts for violating the platform's impersonation policy.", "TikTok removed one video identified by NewsGuard for violating the platform's manipulated media policy.", "TikTok barred four videos from being algorithmically boosted for violating the platform's misinformation guidelines."]
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Incident Investigation; Content Safety Controls; System & Feature Restrictions; Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['Jaswant Singh Chail pleaded guilty in February to the charges against him.', 'He apologized to the king and royal family for the "distress and sadness" he caused in a letter to the court.', 'A judge sentenced Chail to nine years in prison.', 'Chail will first be returned to Broadmoor Hospital, a secure psychiatric facility where he has been receiving treatment.', 'If deemed well enough in the future, he will serve the remainder of his sentence in prison.']
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['Meta is limiting the rollout of the AI-generated sticker feature to select English-language users so it can address and correct abuse before it spreads.', 'Meta has implemented filters that block certain words and warn users that their prompt may violate Meta’s community guidelines.']
assigned_subcategories: Staged Deployment; Content Safety Controls

mitigation_taken: ['The Wiz Research Team reported the exposed SAS token and storage account to Microsoft’s MSRC on June 22, 2023.', 'Microsoft invalidated the exposed SAS token on June 24, 2023.', 'Microsoft replaced the SAS token in the GitHub repository on July 7, 2023.', 'Microsoft completed an internal investigation into the potential impact on August 16, 2023.', 'Microsoft publicly disclosed the incident on September 18, 2023.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting; Incident Response & Recovery; Model & Infrastructure Security; Incident Investigation

mitigation_taken: ['Monika Todova quickly had the deepfake audio recording taken down.', "Tomas Krissak found that the clip spread particularly in Telegram channels usually filled with content supporting Fico's party.", 'Researchers at Demagog SK noted a rise in disinformation in the run-up to the election.', 'Progressive Slovakia conducted its own analysis concluding it was better at winning over undecided voters in the last days of the campaign.', "Sergey Naryshkin, head of Russia's foreign intelligence service, issued a statement accusing Washington of trying to subvert the election and accusing Michal Simecka of advocating American interests.", 'Hany Farid publicly warned that deepfakes pose a two-fold threat to the democratic process.']
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; Incident Response & Recovery; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Societal Impact Assessment

mitigation_taken: ['G/O Media said it would promptly fix errors in AI-generated articles.', 'G/O Media committed to thoughtfully gather and act on staff feedback about using AI in its coverage.', 'GMG Union asked readers not to click on any AI-written articles.', 'CNET began overhauling its approach to AI after suffering heavy media criticism.', "The article's authors reached out to G/O Media for comment."]

mitigation_taken: ['Some systems applied warning labels to generated content as a response to biased image generation.', 'Some systems were set to refuse to output content related to particular identities.', 'Eddie conducted a survey of 35 non-cisgender people to gather their opinions on generated images and possible harm mitigation strategies.', 'Eddie presented the proposed mitigation solutions in very neutral language within the survey.', 'Eddie published a paper reporting his findings and providing evidence from the survey about representation and mitigation strategies.', 'A proposed mitigation was for models to ignore non-cisgender identity terms entirely.', 'A proposed mitigation was for models to ignore non-cisgender identity terms but add an identity flag or symbol to the image.', 'A proposed mitigation was to display a message warning users about the possibility of misrepresentation.', 'A proposed mitigation was to add more diverse images of non-cisgender people to the training data to improve model performance.']
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; System & Feature Restrictions; Societal Impact Assessment; Data Governance; Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['Researchers published a study in JAMA Network Open analyzing how race-based adjustments in spirometry software affect diagnosis and care for lung patients.', 'The American Thoracic Society issued a statement recommending replacement of race-focused adjustments in lung-function testing.', 'The American Thoracic Society called for more research into the best way to modify testing software and whether changes might unintentionally cause overdiagnosis.', 'Some other clinical algorithms have already been changed to remove race-based assumptions, including an algorithm that predicts vaginal delivery risk after a prior cesarean section.']
assigned_subcategories: Societal Impact Assessment; Testing & Auditing; Model Safety Engineering; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: ['Meta set up an internal task force to investigate and address these claims.', 'Meta said it works aggressively to fight child exploitation on and off its platforms.', 'Meta said it supports law enforcement in efforts to arrest and prosecute the criminals behind it.', 'Researchers notified Twitter that its basic scanning for known CSAM was broken.', 'Twitter fixed its basic scanning for known CSAM after researchers notified them.', "Twitter cut off the researchers' API access."]
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Model & Infrastructure Security; Incident Response & Recovery; Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: ['The Federal Trade Commission obtained an order against Edmodo for collecting personal data from children without obtaining verifiable parental consent and for outsourcing COPPA compliance responsibilities to schools.', 'During the course of the FTC’s investigation, Edmodo suspended operations in the United States.', 'The proposed order includes a $6 million monetary penalty, which will be suspended due to the company’s inability to pay.', 'The proposed order prohibits Edmodo from conditioning a child’s participation in an activity on the child disclosing more information than is reasonably necessary to participate in such activity.', 'The proposed order requires Edmodo to complete several requirements before obtaining school authorization to collect information from a child.', 'The proposed order prohibits Edmodo from using children’s information for non-educational purposes such as advertising or building user profiles.', 'The proposed order bans Edmodo from using schools as intermediaries in the parental consent process.', 'The proposed order requires Edmodo to implement and adhere to a retention schedule that details what information it collects, what the data is used for, and a time frame for deleting it.', 'The proposed order requires Edmodo to delete models or algorithms developed using personal information collected from children without verifiable parental consent or school authorization.', 'The Commission voted 3-0 to refer the civil penalty complaint and proposed federal order to the Department of Justice.', 'The Department of Justice filed the complaint and stipulated order in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies; Data Governance; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Market Access & Commercial Restrictions

mitigation_taken: ['Google prevented its Photos app from categorizing images as "gorillas".', 'Google prevented its Photos app from labeling images as monkeys or apes.', 'Apple appeared to disable the ability to search for monkeys and apes in Apple Photos.', 'Apple declined to comment on users’ inability to search for most primates in its app.', 'Google profusely apologized for the incident in which images of Black people were labeled as gorillas.', 'Google vowed to fix the problem after the incident.', 'Google said it had improved its technology by partnering with experts and diversifying its image datasets.', 'In 2019, Google tried to improve a facial-recognition feature by increasing the number of people with dark skin in its training dataset.', 'Contractors hired by Google targeted homeless people and students to collect facial scans as part of the 2019 data-collection effort.', "Google rushed to fix the Nest camera's misclassification problem before users had access to the product.", 'A Google customer support representative advised Nest users to delete all of their labels and start over when the system mixed up faces.', "Microsoft limited users' ability to interact with its Bing chatbot after the chatbot instigated inappropriate conversations.", 'Representatives from Amazon and Microsoft said the companies were always seeking to improve their products.']
assigned_subcategories: System & Feature Restrictions; Data Governance; Model Safety Engineering; Staged Deployment; Usage & Access Limitations

mitigation_taken: Amazon removed the impostor book and numerous other listings by the same publisher from its site; CNET investigated its use of AI after criticism and found that many of its 77 AI-drafted stories contained errors; Ingenio disclosed to readers that it uses AI to produce content; Ingenio's dreamdiary.com states that each article produced with AI is reviewed by a human editor; NewsGuard identified 49 news websites across seven languages that appeared to be mostly or entirely AI-generated; NewsGuard searched the web and used analytics tools to find sites by looking for telltale phrases such as "As an AI language model"; Semrush surveyed its customers about their use of automated tools and reported that many had experimented with generative AI and many used it for most of their content; Textbroker began training some of its writers to use AI tools to increase productivity; Several companies publicly defended their use of AI, saying they use language tools to make writers more productive or to produce content they otherwise would not; Google clarified that it allows AI-generated content in search results as long as the AI is not used to manipulate a site's search rankings and said its algorithms focus on content quality.
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls, Post-Deployment Monitoring, Testing & Auditing, Risk Disclosure, Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: Two Cigna members filed a class-action lawsuit in federal court in Sacramento alleging that Cigna automatically rejected hundreds of thousands of patient claims; The lawsuit seeks unspecified damages and a jury trial; Cigna Healthcare issued a public statement disputing the lawsuit, calling it highly questionable and based on a poorly reported article; Cigna stated that it provides clear guidance on resubmission and how to appeal when codes are submitted incorrectly.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Governance Disclosure, User Rights & Recourse

mitigation_taken: Porcha Woodruff filed a lawsuit in U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan naming the city and Detective LaShauntia Oliver as defendants; The Wayne County Prosecutor's Office dropped the case on March 6 for insufficient evidence; Detroit Police Chief James E. White reviewed the allegations in the lawsuit; The department stated it could not comment further due to the need for additional investigation and would provide further information once more facts were obtained; Woodruff was released from the Detroit Detention Center on a $100,000 personal bond; Woodruff later received medical treatment and was diagnosed with stress-related health issues.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Incident Investigation

mitigation_taken: Playground AI founder Suhail Doshi replied directly to Wang on Twitter; Doshi offered to help Wang get a better result; Doshi publicly stated that Playground AI was displeased with the output and hoped to solve it; Doshi stated that Playground AI does not support AI photo avatar use cases; Doshi explained that the models are not instructable enough to preserve a person’s identity and instead pick generic features based on prompts.
assigned_subcategories: User Rights & Recourse, System Documentation, Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: The supermarket stated it would continue fine-tuning the bot’s controls to ensure safety and usefulness; A warning notice was added stating that recipes are not reviewed by a human; The supermarket warned that it does not guarantee recipes are complete, balanced, or suitable for consumption; Users were advised to use their own judgment before relying on recipes produced by the bot.

mitigation_taken: ['The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration opened a safety-defect probe into nearly 600 Cruise driverless cars.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration launched an investigation to determine the scope and severity of the potential problem.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is investigating reports of Cruise vehicles encroaching on pedestrians present in or entering roadways, including crosswalks.', 'The California Department of Motor Vehicles initiated its own investigation into incidents involving Cruise vehicles in San Francisco.', 'Cruise said it regularly communicates with the NHTSA.', "Cruise said it is cooperating with the NHTSA's requests for information.", 'Cruise briefed the NHTSA on the incident.', 'Cruise showed the NHTSA video footage of the incident.', 'Cruise has been actively working with police to help identify the responsible driver.', "Cruise agreed to reduce its fleet in half while the California DMV's probe continues.", 'Cruise limited its operations to no more than 50 driverless vehicles operating in the day and 150 at night.', 'Rescue crews lifted the car off the injured woman.', 'The injured woman was transported to the hospital.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration opened a probe in December 2022 into about 240 Cruise driverless cars.']

mitigation_taken: ['Westfield High School confirmed the incident in an email to parents.', 'Westfield police opened an investigation into the incident.', 'New Jersey state senator Jon Bramnick asked the Union County prosecutor to investigate the Westfield High case.', 'School administrators began interviewing boys who might have known more information about the images.', 'Principal Mary Asfendis pledged to continue teaching students about responsible technology use.', 'School administrators informed several girls that some boys had identified them in the generated images.', 'Multiple parents filed police reports with local law enforcement about the incident.', 'Westfield Mayor Shelley Brindle encouraged people affected by the situation to give statements to the police.', "A meeting was held at a parent's home that included parents, the mayor, the state senator, town-council members, and a school-board member to discuss the situation.", 'The school held a group counseling session for students affected by the incident.', 'Some female students deleted their social-media accounts after learning about the fabricated images.', 'Tech firms including Snap and TikTok pledged to work with government groups to stop AI-generated sexual images from circulating.', 'Snap and other platforms stated that they ban AI-generated sexual images of minors and report such content to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children.', 'Senator Jon Bramnick said he intends to draft a bill to criminalize the creation and sharing of such faked sexual material if no applicable state law exists.', 'The Biden administration called for preventing generative AI from producing child sexual-abuse material or non-consensual intimate imagery as part of a broader executive order on AI.']

mitigation_taken: ['The man was sentenced to two and a half years in prison by the Busan District Court.', 'The roughly 360 AI-generated images were confiscated by police.', 'Prosecutors argued during the case that the legal definition of sexually exploitative material should include descriptions of sexual behaviors by "virtual humans" and not just the appearance of actual children.', 'Police in Spain launched an investigation after images of underage girls were altered with AI and circulated.', 'Twitch tightened its policies in response to the deepfake sexual-video controversy.', 'TikTok added further restrictions on sharing AI deepfakes in March.', 'Other major platforms began updating their rules regarding deepfakes and AI content.', 'The European Union set regulations in June on how companies can use AI.', 'China implemented AI regulations in July.', 'Several major tech leaders, including Bill Gates, Elon Musk, and Mark Zuckerberg, gathered in Washington.', 'The U.S. Senate prepared to draft legislation on AI.']

mitigation_taken: ['David Tatum was sentenced to 40 years in prison followed by 30 years of supervised release.', 'Tatum was ordered to pay restitution in an amount to be determined within 90 days.', 'Tatum was ordered to pay a $100 special assessment per count of conviction.', 'Tatum was ordered to pay a special assessment totaling $99,000 under the Amy, Vicky, and Andy Child Pornography Victim Assistance Act (AVAA).', 'After he is released from prison, Tatum will be required to register with the Sex Offender Registry Board in any state or jurisdiction where he works or resides.', 'On May 4, a federal jury in Charlotte convicted Tatum of one count of production of child pornography, one count of transportation of child pornography, and one count of possession of child pornography.', 'Tatum is currently in federal custody and will be transferred to the custody of the federal Bureau of Prisons upon designation of a federal facility.', 'The FBI conducted an investigation of the case.', 'Assistant United States Attorneys Daniel Cervantes and Mark T. Odulio prosecuted the case.', 'The case was brought as part of Project Safe Childhood.']

mitigation_taken: ['A spokesperson for Mr Starmer confirmed to Full Fact that the video is not genuine.', 'Full Fact could not find any reports by either the government or reliable sources describing such an investment scheme.', 'Full Fact reported that the footage appears to be a deepfake video created by cloning Mr Starmer’s voice.', "Mike Russell told Full Fact that the repeated use of the word 'pounds' gives the deepfake audio away.", 'Dr Dominic Lees told Full Fact that blurriness or smudging around the mouth is a telltale sign of poorly lip synced deepfake videos.', 'Full Fact wrote about other examples of audio clips that it found no evidence were real.', 'Full Fact warned readers that misinformation spreads quickly online and advised them to consider whether something is likely to be genuine before sharing.']

mitigation_taken: ['The estates of two deceased people filed a lawsuit in the US District Court for the District of Minnesota seeking class-action status and damages against UnitedHealth and NaviHealth.', 'Stat News conducted an investigation using internal documents, communications, and interviews with former NaviHealth employees about nH Predict and its use.', 'Patients and their doctors filed internal appeals and federal Administrative Law Judge proceedings challenging coverage denials, which the lawsuit claims resulted in over 90 percent of the denials being reversed.', "In 2022 NaviHealth instructed case managers to keep patients' stays in nursing homes within 3 percent of the days projected by the nH Predict algorithm.", "In 2023 NaviHealth tightened that requirement by instructing case managers to keep patients' stays within 1 percent of the algorithm's projected days.", 'NaviHealth disciplined or fired case managers who fell outside the length-of-stay target.', "NaviHealth provided training documents instructing case managers to defend the algorithm's estimates to patients and care providers using specific tactics.", 'Optum Health, a UnitedHealth subsidiary, issued an emailed public statement denying that the naviHealth predict tool is used to make coverage determinations and stating the company will defend the lawsuit vigorously.', 'Supervisors directed case managers to immediately restart case review processes for patients who won appeals, often leading to new denials.']

mitigation_taken: ['The TikTok videos were taken down after they were posted.', 'School authorities publicly condemned the videos as blatant racism.', "On Feb. 15 the Carmel Central School District Board of Education issued a statement acknowledging the incident involved fake videos created using artificial intelligence and impersonating district and sheriff's department members.", "The district stated the students who posted the videos would be dealt with in accordance with the District's Code of Conduct.", "Once the Mahopac school authorities became aware of a Snapchat threat, they alerted the Carmel Police Department and the Putnam County Sheriff's Office.", 'Law enforcement investigated the Mahopac Snapchat threat immediately and identified the student responsible.', "Despite deeming the Mahopac Snapchat threat non-credible, the Putnam County Sheriff's Office provided additional officers at the middle school on Monday.", "Officials from the Putnam County Sheriff's Office attended a Monday night school meeting to address parents' concerns.", 'The superintendent of Mahopac Central School District issued a note to parents informing them of the racist threat made by a student.', 'Carmel superintendent Mary-Margaret Zehr spoke at the Carmel Central School District board meeting about her findings from two public meetings with concerned parents.', 'The district announced it will implement improved communications systems to address shortcomings in handling the situation.', 'The district announced it will implement an anonymous alert system that allows students to anonymously report issues and concerns.', 'Some parents plan to file a lawsuit against the school authorities over their handling of the incident.']

mitigation_taken: ['A federal judge ruled that the insurer owed Frances Walter thousands of dollars for more than three weeks of treatment.', 'While contesting the denial, Frances Walter spent down her life savings to pay for care.', 'While contesting the denial, Frances Walter enrolled in Medicaid to cover her care.', "UnitedHealthcare and other insurers said they offer to discuss a patient's care with providers before making a denial.", 'NaviHealth stated that it routinely shares the findings of its algorithm with doctors, patients, and caregivers to help guide care.', 'Providers and patients filed appeals to contest Medicare Advantage denials, with appeals increasing 58% between 2020 and 2022 and nearly 150,000 requests filed in 2022.', "Atrium Health's Brian Moore conducted a deeper review of medical necessity criteria and denials.", "The Greater Wisconsin Agency on Aging Resources agreed to take up Holly Hennessy and her mother's appeal.", "A judge ruled that UnitedHealthcare must pay Dolores Millam's nursing home treatment in full.", "Federal inspectors examined denials made in 2019 and found that private insurers repeatedly strayed beyond Medicare's rules.", 'Federal Medicare officials proposed new rules prohibiting Medicare Advantage insurers from denying coverage based on internal, proprietary, or external clinical criteria not found in traditional Medicare coverage policies.', 'Federal Medicare officials proposed that insurers create an annual utilization management committee to review their practices.', 'Most denials for skilled nursing care were eventually overturned either by the plan itself or by an independent body that adjudicates Medicare appeals.', "America's Health Insurance Plans submitted comments to Medicare urging regulators not to adopt policies that would place limits on plan flexibility to manage post-acute care."]

Review required."', 'Turnitin tuned its detection system to require higher confidence before flagging a sentence as AI-generated.', 'Turnitin reran the sample essays through its system in late March to reassess detection results.', 'Turnitin said it will keep adjusting its software based on feedback and new AI advancements.', 'Turnitin committed to transparency and to continue iterating on the user experience as it learns from students and educators.', 'Some customers asked Turnitin not to display the AI writing score on student work.', 'Mitchel Sollenberger asked Turnitin not to activate AI detection for his campus at its initial launch.', "Rebecca Dell taught an entire lesson to her AP English class on what ChatGPT is and isn't, including asking it to write an essay and having the class analyze its performance."]

mitigation_taken: ["Mr. Reid's parents made phone calls seeking help after his arrest.", "Mr. Reid's family retained an Atlanta lawyer from the Cochran Firm.", "At the lawyer's suggestion, the family cold-called law firms in Jefferson Parish and Baton Rouge until they found a local attorney.", 'The family retained Jefferson Parish criminal defense lawyer Thomas Calogero that Sunday.', 'Mr. Calogero went to the consignment store and spoke with the owner to view the surveillance still.', 'Mr. Calogero gathered photos and videos of Mr. Reid from his family and sent them to the Jefferson Parish Sheriff’s Office on Nov. 30.', 'Mr. Calogero spoke to the New Orleans news outlet NOLA.com about what he believed had happened.', 'An officer called to inform Mr. Calogero that the police were withdrawing the warrant because they had noticed a mole on Mr. Reid’s face that the alleged purse thief did not have.', 'A Jefferson Parish judge recalled the arrest warrant on Wednesday afternoon.', 'Mr. Reid was released from jail late Thursday night.', "Mr. Reid's family spent thousands of dollars pursuing information and legal assistance after the arrest."]

mitigation_taken: ["Kaitlin Jackson called the Bronx District Attorney's Office to ask how police had identified her client.", 'A judge ordered a hearing to determine whether the identification process had been unduly suggestive.', 'Prosecutors offered the defendant a plea deal to plead guilty to petit larceny in exchange for a sentence of time served.', 'Kaitlin Jackson created a guide for the National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers advising attorneys how to spot the use of facial recognition and request supporting materials.', 'Attorneys representing Michael Oliver and Robert Williams requested lists of all potential matches returned by facial recognition systems as part of lawsuits against police.', 'Police departments in New York City and Detroit adopted policies governing the use of facial recognition.', 'The New York and Detroit policies require two people to review the results of a facial recognition scan before the results are turned over to detectives.', 'The New York and Detroit policies prohibit using facial recognition alone as probable cause to carry out a search warrant or arrest.', "New York's facial recognition policy, effective March 2020, was updated to require prosecutors to tell defendants when facial recognition is used to identify them.", 'Utah and Washington enacted laws requiring police to disclose the use of facial recognition in criminal cases.', "Washington's law prohibits using facial recognition alone to establish probable cause in an investigation.", "Washington's law requires independent tests of any facial recognition systems used by state agencies.", 'A group representing chiefs of police from major US cities publicly called for police to disclose when facial recognition is used to help identify a suspect.', 'The Center for Strategic and International Studies published a report recommending that Congress create national standards to prevent a patchwork of regulation for facial recognition.', 'Seven US states and cities, including Boston and San Francisco, adopted full or partial bans on government use of facial recognition.', 'The National District Attorneys Association instructed its members to use professional judgment and discretion when deciding whether to divulge the use of facial recognition in investigations.', 'White House science and tech policy leaders endorsed more disclosure around the use of artificial intelligence as part of an AI Bill of Rights.', 'Clare Garvie trained more than 2,000 defense attorneys on how to spot the use of facial recognition technology.', 'Police offered a man charged with multiple counts of robbery a plea deal of 20 hours of community service after a defense attorney requested information about a facial recognition system.', 'Willie Lynch appealed to the Florida Supreme Court seeking more information about how facial recognition was used in his case, and the appeal was supported by groups including the ACLU, Electronic Frontier Foundation, Georgetown Law Center on Privacy and Technology, and the Innocence Project.']

mitigation_taken: ['Olivia filed a detailed complaint with the TSA days after the incident.', "Six weeks after she filed her complaint, the TSA's Office for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, Ombudsman and Traveler Engagement sent Olivia a letter sharing the conclusions of the agency's investigation that the officers followed Standard Operating Procedures.", "The TSA's investigation involved a collection and review of eyewitness statements, closed-circuit television footage, and other evidence.", 'Olivia filed a Freedom of Information Act request for the evidence the TSA said it reviewed, and the TSA denied her request.', 'ProPublica filed a Freedom of Information Act request in April seeking information about each complaint in the TSA categories, but the agency has not yet provided any response.', 'ProPublica submitted a FOIA request for documents related to the investigation along with a privacy waiver signed by Olivia, and the agency has yet to provide the requested records citing a backlog.', 'The TSA rolled out a new online transgender awareness training in February that is mandatory for its 43,000 screeners.', 'The TSA stated that it is studying options for better screening technology.', 'L3Harris Technologies said it is working with the TSA to develop scanner technology that moves away from current male/female imagery and will screen passengers without gender-specific images.', 'Rep. Kathleen Rice introduced the Screening With Dignity Act in 2018 proposing funding for TSA training and a feasibility study for retrofitting or replacing millimeter wave scanners.', 'Former TSA administrator Peter Neffenger focused on developing a nationwide training program for officers during his tenure.', 'The TSA declined to provide a copy of the transgender awareness training materials, stating they are sensitive security information.']

mitigation_taken: ['A research team from the University of Cambridge examined more than 400 Covid-19 AI models in a review.', 'The University of Cambridge team performed an initial quality screening that excluded all but 62 of the reviewed papers.', 'The Cambridge researchers used the CLAIM methodology checklist to evaluate the studies.', 'The Cambridge researchers published a paper highlighting methodological flaws and urging the use of checklists.', 'STAT conducted an investigation into FDA-cleared AI products to assess data disclosure practices.', 'Stanford researchers published a paper highlighting the lack of prospective studies and demographic performance reporting for high-risk AI products.', 'Multiple papers and editorials called for better evaluation models and urged researchers to be more transparent about their methods.', 'MIT researchers reviewed 511 machine learning studies across fields to assess replicability and data-sharing practices in health care.', 'McDermott recommended using federated learning as a way for institutions to jointly develop models without exchanging their underlying data.', 'Some researchers began using synthetic data modeled on real patients to help preserve privacy while enabling evaluation and development of AI models.']

mitigation_taken: ['Reuters provided New Jersey Transit with its findings from its examination of the decision to leave trains at the Meadows Maintenance Complex.', "Reuters asked New Jersey Transit a series of specific questions about how the software models factored into the agency's decision and whether officials were aware their models did not match surge predictions from federal agencies.", 'Reuters requested the forecast documents that New Jersey Transit relied upon in deciding to leave the trains at the yard.', 'After the New Jersey General Assembly hearing, Reuters again asked for the specific forecast documents.', 'A New Jersey Transit spokesman said the agency was reviewing the Reuters analysis.', 'New Jersey Transit sent a statement asserting it used the most current weather forecasts, available data, accepted analysis practices by emergency management professionals, and historical experience to inform and guide decisions.', 'New Jersey Transit released documents to Reuters under the New Jersey Open Public Records Act.', 'New Jersey Transit Executive Director James Weinstein testified before New Jersey lawmakers that the decisions on where to keep and move rail cars and locomotives were based on the best weather models and forecasts, historical experience, and other information.', 'National Weather Service meteorologists in two offices publicly agreed that the wrong software settings were used by New Jersey Transit.', 'A National Weather Service official said the agency is prepared to help or train any emergency manager in the use of the modeling software.']

mitigation_taken: ['Scott DeDore regularly shared his ShotSpotter accuracy findings with multiple units across the Chicago Police Department and with ShotSpotter representatives.', "Scott DeDore worked with ShotSpotter to install additional sensors to try to improve the system's accuracy.", 'DeDore tracked his findings in spreadsheets and prepared PowerPoint presentations that documented ShotSpotter misses and related incident details.', 'DeDore mapped recent ShotSpotter misses prior to a meeting about misses and service enhancement.', 'ShotSpotter increased microphone placement in the tenth (010th) district and made adjustments in December based on geographic mapping of documented misses.', 'ShotSpotter made several site visits to the tenth district and installed additional microphones.', "Chicago Police Department leadership and ShotSpotter representatives held a meeting titled 'Shotspotter Reported Misses and Service Enhancement' to discuss reported misses.", 'Then-mayor Rahm Emanuel signed a new three-year, $33 million contract extension with ShotSpotter in August 2018.', "SoundThinking (formerly ShotSpotter) commissioned a report from consulting firm Edgeworth Economics assessing the system's accuracy.", 'In June 2023 the City of Chicago approved a $10 million payment to SoundThinking.', "Chicago's 2024 budget included roughly $9 million in a line item for Software Maintenance and Licensing to fund continued use of the acoustic gunshot detection technology.", "More than 80 community groups and over 500 individuals signed an open letter calling on the Johnson administration to end the city's relationship with ShotSpotter and redirect funds to housing, education, and health care."]

mitigation_taken: ["PTI posted on X from the party's official account that the audio was fake and alleged controlled media were running fake news about PTI boycotting the elections.", 'PTI leader Zulfi Bukhari told Logically Facts that the audio was fabricated and dismissed any notion of a boycott.', 'Independent experts consulted by Logically Facts confirmed with a high degree of certainty that the audio was artificially generated and did not originate from Imran Khan.', 'Audio forensics expert Tanmay Srivastava noted the presence of an unnatural white noise throughout the recording that was likely added in post-production.', 'Tanmay Srivastava observed that the intonation of the voice in the clip was monotone with no natural variation in pitch or tone.', 'Tanmay Srivastava stated that sibilant consonants in the clip sounded mechanical or highly processed rather than natural.', 'Tanmay Srivastava highlighted specific timestamps (including 0:38-0:39, 0:02-0:03, 0:28-0:29, 1:15-1:17, and 1:03-1:05) where the audio appeared heavily edited or had unnatural noises added.', "Experts from IIT Jodhpur led by Professor Mayank Vatsa used four distinct deep-learning models to evaluate the audio's authenticity.", 'The IIT Jodhpur team shared their high-confidence model findings with Logically Facts.', 'PTI officials actively countered deepfake narratives by clarifying the authenticity of videos and audio clips attributed to them.', 'PTI leader Muhammad Basharat Raja posted on X that a video claiming he would boycott the elections was an AI-generated deepfake.', 'Muhammad Basharat Raja stated that he would be standing in the current election.', 'The Information Secretary of PTI London flagged another digitally altered video of a PTI leader purportedly announcing a boycott.']

mitigation_taken: ["The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration opened a new investigation into the adequacy of Tesla's December recall of Autopilot-equipped vehicles.", 'The NHTSA closed its earlier probe into Autopilot and opened a new probe focused on the recall remedy.', "The NHTSA published a report detailing its examination of Tesla's Autopilot.", 'The NHTSA performed preliminary tests on remedied vehicles following the recall.', 'Tesla issued a recall for more than 2 million Model Y, X, S, 3 and Cybertruck vehicles equipped with Autopilot.', 'Tesla deployed the recall through a software update to affected vehicles.', 'Tesla said it installed new safeguards in the updated vehicle software to prevent driver misuse.', 'The U.S. Department of Justice opened an investigation into whether Tesla misled customers and investors about Autopilot.', 'The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission opened an investigation into whether Tesla misled customers and investors about Autopilot.', 'Tesla reached a settlement with the family of Walter Huang over a fatal 2018 crash involving Autopilot.']

mitigation_taken: ["City & State tested the Meta AI chatbot by querying over a dozen state lawmakers' names with the phrase 'sexual harassment' to investigate fabricated allegations.", 'City & State tested the free version of ChatGPT to see whether it would also fabricate allegations against lawmakers.', 'Meta stated that it shares information within the features themselves to help people understand that AI might return inaccurate or inappropriate outputs.', 'Meta said it has constantly released updates and improvements to its models since launch and is continuing to work on making them better.', "The recently passed state budget included provisions to penalize the use of deceptive 'deepfake' images and audio for marketing, sex act, or election purposes.", 'The recently passed state budget required that any election material that utilizes AI include a disclaimer.', 'Assembly Member Clyde Vanel said his committee is actively looking into ways to combat harms posed by AI through legislation.', 'Assembly Member Clyde Vanel said his committee is actively looking into ways to combat harms posed by AI through educating the public.']

mitigation_taken: ['Jack Posobiec, in the clip immediately following the deepfake, explicitly stated that the video was AI-generated and fabricated.', "@TPostMillenial acknowledged in its post that the clip was an AI-generated imagining, writing 'AI imagines what would happen if Biden declares and activates the Selective Service Act...'.", 'Snopes published a fact-check article determining the video is an AI-generated deepfake and rated the claim False and Miscaptioned.', 'Snopes analyzed the video and highlighted telltale signs of a deepfake, noting that Biden stands very still and only his mouth moves.', 'Snopes linked to and recommended a guide on how to spot deepfakes to educate readers.', 'Snopes explained the role of generative adversarial networks (GANs) and how deepfakes are created as part of its corrective coverage.']
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; Training & Supportive Measures; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ["The Markup tested the city's chatbot and reported its inaccuracies.", "After being alerted to The Markup's testing, Rosalind Black tested the chatbot herself and found additional false information.", 'The city said it will continue to focus on upgrading the chatbot.', 'The city said it will review user questions to improve answers and address "harmful, illegal, or otherwise inappropriate" content.', 'The city said it will delete chatbot data within 30 days.', 'A pop-up notice on the chatbot page encourages visitors to report inaccuracies through a feedback form.', 'The chatbot page discloses risks to users.', 'The feedback form asks users to rate their experience from one to five stars.']

mitigation_taken: ['Brookdale disputed the allegations in the lawsuits and said it empowers local facility managers to set staffing levels as they see fit.', 'Brookdale sent people to help McNeal conduct new health assessments of her residents.', 'After studying transport times at the Chicago facility, Brookdale agreed to reinstate the staffing level that existed before Service Alignment.', 'Kelly Rubin sent an email to regional managers warning that no facility would be granted more than two additional full-time employees regardless of what the algorithm said.', 'Brookdale intervened at facilities where the algorithm suggested more staff was needed.', 'Managers who scheduled more employees than the algorithm advised were required to propose a plan of correction.', 'Repeat offenders who scheduled more staff risked losing portions of their annual bonus.', 'Brookdale implemented a policy to charge residents additional monthly fees when they required more caregiver time.', 'Caregivers were instructed to report residents who routinely needed more time so managers could reassess their needs and potentially increase fees.', "Brookdale fired McNeal for scheduling additional workers as 'training' staff without company approval.", "State investigators cited Brookdale for medical neglect after Louise Walker's death.", 'Police conducted an investigation into the Christmas Day 2020 death in Destin, Fla., and found the man had been left unattended for more than 12 hours.', "Brookdale provided time-sheet data covering seven North Carolina facilities to a plaintiffs' expert.", 'Brookdale, Sunrise and Atria Senior Living provided responses to questions from a congressional committee inquiry.', "Brookdale's lawyers denied in court filings that any of the facility's actions caused Walker's death."]

mitigation_taken: ['Ernie Smith posted details of the DMCA notice in a Mastodon thread.', "404 Media investigated Commonwealth Legal and published reporting detailing problems with the firm's site and claims.", "Reality Defender analyzed the attorneys' images and reported that each image showed signs of AI generation, most likely by a GAN model.", "Reporters checked the firm's domain registration and found the domain was registered on March 1, 2024 and hosted on a Canadian IP.", "Reporters checked the address listed on the firm's website and found that the physical location did not match the 'fourth floor' indicated on the site.", "404 Media examined the attorneys' bios and identified implausible or inconsistent education and practice details.", 'The owner of Tech4Gods spoke to 404 Media and said he had purchased backlinks for his site.', 'The owner of Tech4Gods told 404 Media he did not own the disputed image or any images.', "The owner of Tech4Gods suggested to 404 Media that a disgruntled former contractor may be attempting to harm his site's ranking by adding spam links.", "The article was updated to include Ernie Smith's response.", 'Ernie Smith told Ars that he had not heard back from Commonwealth Legal after the five business days had passed.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Testing & Auditing; Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['OpenAI created a speech recognition tool called Whisper to transcribe audio from YouTube videos and podcasts.', 'An OpenAI team transcribed more than one million hours of YouTube videos and fed the resulting texts into GPT-4.', 'Greg Brockman personally helped gather YouTube videos for the transcriptions.', 'OpenAI released GPT-4, which drew on the transcribed YouTube videos.', 'OpenAI publicly stated that each of its A.I. models has a unique curated data set and that it uses numerous sources of data.', "Google's legal department asked the privacy team to draft language to broaden what the company could use consumer data for.", "Google's privacy team wrote new terms to allow the company to use publicly available content from Google Docs, Google Sheets and related apps for training its A.I. models and building products and features.", 'Google instructed employees to release the new terms on the Fourth of July weekend.', 'Google released the revised privacy policy on July 1.', 'Google stated that it did not use information from Google Docs or related apps to train language models without explicit permission and that it did not start training on additional types of data based on this language change.', 'The New York Times sued OpenAI and Microsoft for using copyrighted news articles without permission to train A.I. chatbots.', 'More than 10,000 trade groups, authors, companies and others submitted comments to the Copyright Office about the use of creative works by A.I. models.', 'Meta hired contractors in Africa to aggregate summaries of fiction and nonfiction, which included copyrighted content.', 'Some Meta employees proposed paying $10 per book to obtain full licensing rights to books.', 'Meta executives and managers discussed acquiring the publishing house Simon & Schuster to procure long works for training data.', "Meta's executives agreed to lean on the 2015 Authors Guild v. Google court decision as a legal justification for using copyrighted works to train A.I.", 'OpenAI and other companies began investigating synthetic data approaches, including methods where one A.I. system generates data and a second judges the information to separate the good from the bad.', 'Sam Altman publicly acknowledged at a conference that A.I. companies would use up all viable data on the internet.']

mitigation_taken: ["Tianle Cai accessed GPT-4o's public token library and extracted the 100 longest Chinese tokens.", 'Tianle Cai posted the list of the 100 longest Chinese tokens on GitHub.', 'Deedy Das used language filters to count the number of tokens in different languages and examined token distributions across languages.', 'Zhengyang Geng asked GPT-4o to translate some of the long Chinese tokens as part of his investigation.', 'Zhengyang Geng conducted personal red-teaming experiments using the rare tokens to attempt to jailbreak GPT-4o.', 'Zhengyang Geng chose not to share the details of his red-teaming experiments with the public.', 'Sander Land and Max Bartolo drafted a paper on how to detect unusual tokens that can cause models to glitch.', "During Geng's tests, a safety mechanism detected unsafe content and blocked it from being shown to the user.", "Chinese users reported the spam sites appearing in unrelated Google search results and posted complaints in Google Search's support community.", 'An X user reported a similar prevalence of porn and gambling content in Korean tokens.']

mitigation_taken: "The researcher created the 'huggingface-cli' package and uploaded it to the Python Package Index (PyPI).", 'He published research through security firm Vulcan Cyber documenting how AI models can recommend non-existent software packages.', 'He wrote actual packages using names imagined by AI models to test whether invented package names could be co-opted to distribute malicious code.', "He queried four AI models with thousands of 'how to' programming questions across five languages and runtimes to explore the persistence of hallucinated package names.", 'He selected 20 questions at random and posed each 100 times to every model to assess how often hallucinated package names were repetitive.'

mitigation_taken: ['Customers filed dozens of lawsuits against General Motors.', 'General Motors ended its contract with the data broker.', 'Kathleen Lomax canceled her Life360 subscription.', 'Life360 sent Kathleen Lomax an automated response, crafted with the help of AI, stating that Life360 did share driving behavior data with Arity.', 'Rob Leathern made a month of phone calls, emails, and data privacy requests to Toyota and Connected Analytic Services.', 'Connected Analytic Services provided Rob Leathern with a report detailing the previous six months of driving in his SUV.', 'Toyota stated that customers can manage what is shared about them in the data privacy portal of the Toyota/Lexus app.', "Connecticut's insurance regulator issued a consumer alert warning that new cars may track people's driving and affect how much they pay for insurance.", 'Progressive informs eligible customers when quoting a new policy that driving data is available from their vehicle manufacturer and asks if they would like Progressive to use that data to determine their rate.']

mitigation_taken: ['NewsGuard conducted an audit of 10 leading AI chatbots using 570 prompts based on 19 false narratives linked to a Russian disinformation network.', 'NewsGuard tested each of the 19 narratives using three different personas (neutral, leading, and malign actor) to reflect how AI models are used.', 'NewsGuard published a special report uncovering the sophisticated and far‑reaching Russian disinformation network of 167 websites.', 'NewsGuard offered to provide, at no charge, each company responsible for the tested chatbots with their individual audit scores upon request.', 'NewsGuard sent emails to OpenAI, You.com, xAI, Inflection, Mistral, Microsoft, Meta, Anthropic, Google, and Perplexity seeking comment on the findings.', 'NewsGuard fed the chatbots prompts that explicitly attempted to generate disinformation (for example, instructing them to write as a local news site) as part of its testing.', 'A U.S. Secret Service spokesperson told NewsGuard by email that the agency has \'no record of any employee named "Greg Robertson."\'', "The U.S. State Department told NewsGuard in April 2024 that it had 'no information about the existence of any such entity' and that the claim resembles Russian disinformation.", "Egyptian officials told NewsGuard that they did not find any record of a journalist named 'Mohammed Al‑Alawi.'", "The owner of the resort referenced in the false claim told NewsGuard that the allegation about Zelensky's family purchasing the villa was false.", "BIM spokesperson Marlen Koenecke told NewsGuard that the villa was not sold and that the company has never had an employee named 'Sabine Mels.'", "Microsoft and Clemson University documented the disinformation network's modus operandi and contributed reporting that informed the analysis."]
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Risk Disclosure; Incident Reporting; Incident Investigation

mitigation_taken: ['JPMorgan Chase has begun using large-language models to fight identity fraud.', 'JPMorgan Chase has stepped up its efforts to educate customers about scams.', "Financial institutions are tapping AI themselves to shield customers' money and data.", "Banks monitor how customers enter credentials, including which hand they use when swiping and the device's IP address, to build behavioral profiles.", "Banks flag login attempts that don't match a user's typical behavior and may prompt the user to provide additional information before proceeding.", 'Banks monitor shifts in typing cadence to detect when users may be coerced into filling out information.', 'Banks flag copied-and-pasted digits as suspicious.', 'Banks flag voice-verification attempts that are too perfect as red flags.', 'Banks flag text that is too evenly spaced and grammatically perfect as a red flag.', 'Banks and other financial institutions use fraud-detection technology from firms such as RSA Security.', 'Security officials advise consumers to never share financial or personal information unless they are certain about who is on the receiving end.', 'Security officials advise consumers to use a credit card when paying because it offers the most protection.', 'Security officials suggest that consumers turn on two-factor authentication so they get a text or email whenever someone tries logging into an account.', "Security officials advise consumers to pause and 'take a beat' if anything feels off during a potential money exchange.", 'Security officials advise consumers to get a second opinion from a trusted contact when all information about a transaction or account is coming from one person.']
assigned_subcategories: Model & Infrastructure Security; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Content Safety Controls; Training & Supportive Measures; Access Management

mitigation_taken: ['The researchers collected 13,353 listings from nine underground marketplaces and forums between November 30, 2022 and October 12, 2023.', 'The researchers directly engaged with vendors of malicious LLM services.', 'The researchers obtained complimentary copies of some malicious LLM services.', "The researchers purchased some malicious LLM services under close supervision from the university's institutional review board.", 'The researchers examined and analyzed the acquired malicious services to identify backend LLMs and collect prompt-response pairs related to malicious capabilities.', 'The researchers evaluated the performance of the malicious software, including malware generation and phishing capabilities.', 'The researchers published the study titled "Malla: Demystifying Real-world Large Language Model Integrated Malicious Services" documenting their findings.', 'The researchers made the dataset of prompts used to create malware and bypass safety features available for other researchers to study.', 'The authors produced concrete recommendations to build safer models that are resilient against bad actors.']
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Incident Investigation; Model Safety Engineering; System Documentation; Data Governance

mitigation_taken: ['Figma temporarily disabled the "Make Design" feature.', 'Within hours of the report, Figma identified that the issue was related to the underlying design systems created for the feature.', "Figma said it will not re-enable the feature until it has completed a full QA pass on the feature's underlying design system.", 'Figma CEO Dylan Field publicly accepted responsibility for the QA lapse.', 'Field publicly clarified that Make Design uses off-the-shelf large language models combined with commissioned systems and denied that it was trained on Figma content, community files, or app designs.', "Figma pointed to Field's tweets as its statement on the matter."]
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Staged Deployment; Incident Response & Recovery; Governance Disclosure; Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['The parties agreed to a class settlement resolving the lawsuit.', 'The parties asked the United States District Court for the Western District of Missouri to approve the proposed settlement.', "A Notice was issued explaining the action, the proposed settlement, class members' legal rights and options, available benefits, eligibility and procedures, and applicable dates and deadlines.", "A VIN Lookup Portal was made available for owners to determine whether their vehicle is a Settlement Class Vehicle by entering their vehicle's VIN.", 'A deadline was established for settlement class members to postmark requests for exclusion from the settlement (June 17, 2024).', 'A deadline was established for settlement class members to file objections to the settlement (June 17, 2024).', 'A deadline was established for settlement class members to file claims for reimbursement (July 15, 2024).', 'A Final Fairness Hearing was scheduled for July 17, 2024 at 1:30 p.m. in Courtroom 8E at the U.S. District Court, Kansas City.']
assigned_subcategories: Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies; Incident Reporting; User Rights & Recourse; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: ["The Interior Ministry issued a public defense of VioGén and said the government was 'the first to carry out self-criticism' when mistakes occur.", 'The Spanish government called an emergency meeting after three women were killed by former partners within a 24-hour span.', "Interior Minister Fernando Grande-Marlaska publicly said he still had 'absolute confidence' in the system at a news conference.", 'VioGén has been refined and updated over the years, including adding metrics believed to better predict homicide.', 'Police have been required to conduct a follow-up risk assessment within 90 days of an attack.', "After working with a lawyer specializing in gender violence cases, Luz had her risk score increased to 'extreme'.", "Following the increase to 'extreme' risk, Luz received round-the-clock police protection.", 'A few days after the January 2022 attack, Lobna Hemid won a restraining order against her husband.', "In 2020, Stefany González Escarraman's family won a legal verdict against the state for failing to adequately measure risk and provide sufficient protection.", 'Spanish officials are exploring incorporating additional A.I. capabilities into VioGén so it can pull data from different sources and learn more on its own.', 'Victims classified as higher risk receive regular police patrols at their home.', 'Victims classified as higher risk are given access to shelters.', "Victims classified as higher risk have police monitoring of their abuser's movements.", 'In extreme cases, police assign 24-hour surveillance to victims.', "Spanish police are trained to overrule VioGén's recommendations depending on the evidence."]
assigned_subcategories: Risk Management; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Training & Supportive Measures; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Model Safety Engineering

mitigation_taken: ["The user called PayPal's customer service line, and a representative confirmed there was no such transaction.", 'PayPal told the user to email the screenshot to service@paypal.com.', "PayPal's auto-reply informed the user that the service@paypal.com email address is no longer active.", "PayPal's auto-reply directed the user to PayPal's help pages.", 'PayPal\'s auto-reply instructed the user to click "Message Us," which opens a new dialog with the same chatbot.']
