mitigation_taken: ['Hoodline removed fake headshots and fake biographical information from its site.', 'Hoodline replaced the fake headshots and biographies with a small "AI" badge next to each machine-assisted article\'s byline.', "Impress3 (Hoodline's parent company) requested that archived screenshots of the site be removed from the Internet Archive and other parts of the internet.", "Archived screenshots of Hoodline's AI writer pages were wiped from much of the internet at the request of the site's rights holder.", "Zachary Chen publicly defended the site's use of AI and its transparency in statements to CNN.", 'Chen said the outlet has greatly refined its processes and implemented heavy guardrails.', 'Chen said that each AI-assisted article is overseen by editors before it is published.', 'Hoodline said it plans to hire more human journalists as it evolves its AI personas into AI news anchors.', 'The News/Media Alliance supported news organizations taking legal action against AI developers that harvest news content without permission.']

mitigation_taken: ['Microsoft redirected election-related prompts in Copilot to Bing search to help ensure users are getting information from the most authoritative sources.', 'Microsoft said it was putting guardrails in Copilot ahead of the election to be cautious about politics.', 'Google said it was working on improving the Gemini/AI experience as it gets more feedback.', "Google's AI Overview skipped direct AI answers for breaking news and instead showed Google News links.", 'Perplexity prioritized authoritative sources such as government websites for election-related questions.', 'Perplexity included disclaimers in some answers noting that the current health of public figures can change rapidly.', 'Perplexity recommended that users read trusted news outlets for breaking news because they are best equipped to offer real-time updates.', "Meta AI deleted an initially accurate answer about Trump's running mate and replaced it with a message linking to voting information.", 'Some companies started making names and links to sources more visible in their chatbot responses.', 'ChatGPT updated its answer the next day to accurately confirm that an assassination attempt had occurred.', 'ChatGPT added a disclaimer telling people to check other sources for the latest information about the assassination attempt.', 'ChatGPT corrected its response about Biden dropping out within about an hour of the announcement.']

mitigation_taken: ['BNN shut its news arm in May 2024.', 'NewsGuard identified more than 500 unreliable AI-generated websites in October 2023.', "Chris Silver Smith determined that the websites showing up in search results after his brother-in-law's death were spam websites.", 'The New York Times reported that BNN hired would-be journalists from countries like Iraq, Pakistan, Egypt, and Nigeria to put existing stories through generative AI tools before posting them.']

mitigation_taken: ["The misleading story featuring Mr. Fanning's photo was deleted from the internet a day later.", 'Microsoft said it had terminated its licensing agreement with BNN.', "Mr. Fanning's lawyers at Meagher Solicitors reached out to BNN regarding the false story.", 'Mr. Fanning filed a defamation case against BNN and Microsoft in the High Court of Ireland.', 'After a lawyer complained on LinkedIn that a BNN story had invented quotes from him, BNN removed him from the story.', 'BNN changed the date on that story to one before the publication date of the opinion column that the lawyer believed was the source of the quote.', "BNN responded to Mr. Fanning's lawsuit by publishing a story that accused him of 'desperate tactics in money hustling lawsuit.'", 'BNN stopped publishing stories in early April.', 'BNN deleted its content when it went dormant.', "Within a week or so of BNN Breaking's shutting down, the operation moved to a new website called TrimFeed.", 'TrimFeed shut down after a reporter informed Mr. Chahal that the article would soon be published.', "In March, Google rolled out an update to reduce unoriginal content in search results, targeting sites with 'spammy' content.", 'An official with the Maryland Department of Natural Resources chastised BNN on X for its inaccurate claim about Dungeness crabs.', 'The same Maryland official called on Google to delist AI news outfits that aggregate news and get things wildly incorrect.', 'NewsGuard identified more than 800 websites that use A.I. to produce unreliable news content.']

mitigation_taken: ['Some of the politicians targeted have contacted the police.', 'Since the Online Safety Act was introduced in January, sharing such imagery without consent has been made illegal in the UK.', 'The government announced in April plans to close the loophole and ban the creation of deepfake pornography in England and Wales.', 'The proposed law was dropped when Prime Minister Rishi Sunak decided to call an early election.', 'The Conservatives, Labour and the Liberal Democrats have pledged to reintroduce the ban if they win the next election.', 'Some of the biggest sites chose to pre-emptively block British users from their sites.', 'US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is pushing for similar laws in the US.', 'The Guardian conducted an investigation into the ClothOff AI app earlier this year.']

mitigation_taken: ['She made her Instagram account private.', 'She removed photographs of herself in a bathing suit from her Instagram.', 'She stopped walking alone at night.', 'She started triple-checking that her doors and windows were locked before she slept.', 'She altered her professional wardrobe to cover more of her body, favoring high-cut blouses and blazers.', 'She contacted a member of the local police department about the images.', "A member of the local police department referred her to the Florida Department of Law Enforcement's cybercrime division.", "She spoke on the phone with the Florida Department of Law Enforcement's legal adviser.", "She emailed a link to the 4chan images to the Florida Department of Law Enforcement's legal adviser.", "Norma Buster of Carrie Goldberg's firm conducted a case evaluation with Javellana over the phone in February 2021.", 'She sought help from lawyer Carrie Goldberg and her firm regarding the deepfakes.', 'She combed the internet at night for information about intimate-image abuse.', 'Florida Department of Law Enforcement special agents met with her in April 2021 and explained they could not investigate because there were no applicable federal or state laws at the time.', 'FDLE special agents offered to help her write an affidavit declaring that the photographs were not real.', 'She signed the affidavit pages prepared by FDLE special agents.', "She took a screenshot of a news article about Senator Lauren Book's bill, highlighted the language about deepfakes, and posted it to Twitter along with a summary of her own experience, publicly acknowledging the ordeal.", 'She spoke by phone with Senator Lauren Book and subsequently communicated regularly with her.', 'She testified in support of Senate Bill 1798 at a committee hearing in Tallahassee on Feb. 8, 2022.', 'She spoke with news media and publicly called out 4chan users as the architects behind the deepfakes.', 'She ultimately decided against taking County.', 'Senator Lauren Book drafted Senate Bill 1798 to criminalize non-consensual deepfakes.', 'The bill (S.B. 1798) passed in committee by an 8-0 vote.', "S.B. 1798 passed unanimously in Florida's House and Senate.", 'Governor Ron DeSantis signed S.B. 1798 into law on June 24, 2022.', "After S.B. 1798 became law, the Florida Department of Law Enforcement and local law enforcement could investigate victims' claims and perpetrators could be charged, fined and possibly jailed.", 'In January, Congress introduced the Disrupt Explicit Forged Images and Non-Consensual Edits advised caution when posting personal photos or videos online.']

mitigation_taken: ['Herrera was indicted on multiple federal charges related to child sex abuse materials.', 'Herrera made his first appearance in federal court.', 'A federal grand jury charged Herrera with one count of transportation of child pornography, one count of receipt of child pornography, and one count of possession of child pornography.', 'Herrera was arrested the following day.', 'U.S. Magistrate Judge Kyle Reardon ordered that Herrera be detained pending trial.', 'A discovery management conference in the case was scheduled for Oct. 1, 2024.', 'A pre-trial detention document was filed in U.S. District Court for the District of Alaska.', 'A forensic review of three of Herrera’s cell phones was conducted, revealing tens of thousands of videos and images depicting the violent rape and sexual abuse of children.', 'The FBI released a public service announcement warning of the legal consequences of obtaining and creating child sexual abuse material through AI.', 'The Department of Justice announced it is accelerating its enforcement efforts against misuse of generative AI that produces dangerous content such as child sexual abuse material.', "The Justice Department asked the public to contact the Homeland Security Investigations tip line at (877) 447-4847 with information concerning Herrera's alleged actions."]

mitigation_taken: ['AllHere furloughed most of its staff.', "AllHere's founder and chief executive left her role.", 'AllHere posted on its website that the furloughs were because of "our current financial position."', 'The Los Angeles school district took the Ed chatbot offline to refine how it answers user questions.', 'A truncated version of Ed, implemented as a website that gathers information from district apps, remained accessible to families in the district\'s 100 "priority" schools.', 'The district said it would protect data privacy and security on the platform regardless of what happens to AllHere as a company.', 'The district set a goal for the chatbot to be available in September.', "AllHere informed Prince George's County Public Schools that it would no longer be able to provide its text messaging service effective immediately.", "Some customers beyond Los Angeles were told that AllHere's services were essentially defunct."]

mitigation_taken: ['Facebook has taken down many deepfake ads and disabled some of the accounts that were responsible for them.', 'YouTube said it removed more than 15.7 million channels and over 8.2 million videos for violating its guidelines from January to March of this year.', 'YouTube in March required creators to disclose when they use A.I. to create realistic content.', 'Meta said the company was training automated detection systems to catch fraud on its platform.', 'Most traces of Magna-FX were taken offline, including the company website, phone number and email addresses used by the agents Mr. Beauchamp spoke with.', 'Andrew Forrest filed a civil lawsuit against Meta alleging negligence in how its ad business is run.', "Hong Kong's Securities and Futures Commission issued a warning in May about scams featuring Mr. Musk.", 'The Federal Trade Commission warned Americans that A.I.-powered cybercrime and deepfake scams were on the rise.', 'The Federal Bureau of Investigation warned Americans that A.I.-powered cybercrime and deepfake scams were on the rise.', 'Mr. Beauchamp filed a report with the local police.', 'Mr. Beauchamp filed a report with the Better Business Bureau.', 'Sensity analyzed more than 2,000 deepfakes.', 'YouTube pointed to its policies prohibiting scams and manipulated videos.']

mitigation_taken: ["Australia's eSafety Commissioner Julie Inman Grant launched new standards that will specifically deal with websites that can be used to generate child sexual abuse material, slated to come into effect in six months after a 15-day disallowance period in parliament.", 'The eSafety Commission reported that about 85 percent of intimate images and videos reported to her office were successfully removed.', 'Victoria Police arrested a teenager at Bacchus Marsh Grammar for creating nude images of around 50 of his classmates.', 'Victoria Police opened and are conducting an ongoing investigation into the Bacchus Marsh Grammar incident.', 'Salesian College expelled a student after he used AI-powered software to create deepnudes of a female teacher.', 'The federal government introduced legislation to ban the creation and sharing of deepfake pornography, which is currently being debated by parliament.', 'The introduced federal legislation would impose jail terms of up to six years for transmitting sexually explicit material without consent and an additional year if the offender created the deepfake.', 'The federal government brought forward an independent review of the Online Safety Act to ensure it is fit for purpose.']

mitigation_taken: ['Anna McAdams reported the incident to school administrators.', 'School administrators conducted an investigation that identified the perpetrator.', 'The perpetrator was assigned to a separate building on campus for detention for the remainder of the semester.', 'The perpetrator left the school after winter break.', 'The boy was sanctioned within the juvenile justice system.', "The Aledo Independent School District assisted the county sheriff's department with its investigation.", 'The district disciplined the boy in accordance with the student code of conduct and state law.', 'The district is reviewing its student code of conduct with the possible use of AI by students in mind.', 'Anna McAdams reached out to Dorota Mani, the mother of another teen victim.', 'McAdams began calling state and federal officials, including Senator Ted Cruz.', 'Berry and her family shared their story with Senator Ted Cruz.', 'Senators Ted Cruz, Amy Klobuchar and a bipartisan group of senators introduced a bill to criminalize the publication of nonconsensual nude images and to require social-media companies and other websites to remove the pictures within 48 hours of receiving notice from the victim.', "Representative Joseph Morelle reintroduced the 'Preventing Deepfakes of Intimate Images Act,' which has more than 50 co-sponsors and is awaiting consideration by the House Judiciary Committee.", 'Google removed nude-generating AI apps from its app store.', 'Apple removed nude-generating AI apps from its app store.', 'After the fake nudes were shared, Berry removed all her Instagram posts for a few months.', 'After the fake nudes were shared, Berry culled her Instagram followers.', 'Berry now only accepts Instagram follow requests from people she knows well.', 'Berry stayed home from school for a few days.']

mitigation_taken: ['The 18th Judicial District Attorney’s Office searched Colorado court records and found no records corresponding to the purported case.', 'Local law enforcement officials searched their records and found no records corresponding with the purported case.', 'The Colorado Department of Corrections checked its inmate list and found no inmate named Harrison Engelbert.', 'The Littleton Police Department confirmed it did not investigate the crime described in the video and that none of the names used in the segment were people the department had interacted with.', 'Google reverse image searches of the photographs used in the video were run and did not turn up real results.', 'Google searches for news coverage from 2014 yielded no coverage of the alleged case.', 'Google searches revealed dozens of knock-off YouTube videos, TikToks, and webpages summarizing the original fake video.']

mitigation_taken: ['Senator Ben Cardin ended the call when he determined the individual was not who they claimed to be.', "Cardin's office alerted the relevant authorities.", 'The matter was handed to law enforcement and a comprehensive investigation is underway.', 'Committee staff were instructed to exercise an extra degree of caution with external communications.', 'Committee staff were instructed to pay particularly close attention to the numbers and emails of incoming individuals claiming to be powerful people.', 'Dmytro Kuleba issued a statement warning people to stay alert.', 'Kuleba advised people to always verify the source and not tell the truth to strangers.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Hangzhou Public Security Bureau held a press conference on September 13 to disclose details of the case.', 'In June, Hangzhou cyber police discovered a criminal gang using AI face-swapping on overseas platforms to bypass login authentication and harvest user information.', 'Following investigation by municipal and district public security organs, police successfully identified the four suspects.', 'In August, the special task force arrested the four suspects in Anhui, Guizhou, and Zhejiang and placed them under criminal detention.', 'The police warned the public to secure personal devices such as phones and computers and to avoid clicking unknown links.', 'The police urged enterprise platforms to accelerate upgrades and add optical and other facial authentication functions to better protect privacy.', 'As part of the summer security crackdown, Hangzhou police dismantled 235 criminal gangs.', 'During the operation, Hangzhou police arrested more than 10,000 suspects.', 'During the operation, Hangzhou police captured 632 fugitives.', 'During the operation, Hangzhou police solved over 4,000 cases.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Model & Infrastructure Security; Risk Disclosure; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['The Office of the Victorian Information Commissioner issued a compliance notice to the Department of Families, Fairness and Housing to ban the use of generative AI tools.', 'The Office of the Victorian Information Commissioner issued a compliance notice requiring the department to technically block internal access to generative AI tools.', 'OVIC gave the department until November 5 to implement technical controls blocking access to web-based or external API-based generative AI text tools including ChatGPT, ChatSonic, Claude, Copy.AI, Meta AI, Grammarly, HuggingChat, Jasper, NeuroFlash, Poe, ScribeHow, QuillBot, Wordtune, Gemini, and Microsoft 365 Copilot.', "The department conducted an internal review of cases handled by the case worker's unit over a one-year period and identified 100 cases with indicators that ChatGPT may have been used to draft child protection related documents.", 'The case worker involved in the incident is no longer employed by the department.', 'In a letter to OVIC, the department accepted that there was an unauthorised use of ChatGPT when developing the child protection report.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Access Management; System & Feature Restrictions; Testing & Auditing; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['School districts scrambled to slash programs.', 'School districts redid their budgets.', 'Infinite Campus removed race, gender and birth country as factors from its model before the current school year.', 'Infinite Campus offered some broad insights into how its model works.', 'The Carson City district created a new position at each school to help students struggling with academics or behavior.']

mitigation_taken: ['After the publication of the report, TikTok removed at least one account that Media Matters had identified as posting seemingly AI-generated English-language Hitler speeches.', 'TikTok removed some of the videos that Media Matters identified containing the AI-generated Hitler audios.', 'TikTok removed another account that Media Matters had identified as seemingly dedicated to posting reconstructed Hitler speech audios.', 'TikTok removed a specific AI-generated Hitler audio that had been used at least 251 times prior to its removal.', 'TikTok removed another AI-generated Hitler audio that had been used at least 55 times prior to its removal.']

mitigation_taken: ['ISD identified and recorded a list of 200 pro-Nazi TikTok accounts.', 'ISD reported a sample of 50 of those accounts to TikTok for hate speech and guideline violations.', 'ISD created and used dummy TikTok accounts to explore the For You Page and test algorithmic recommendations.', 'ISD followed dozens of the accounts to gain access to private videos and content on channels set to private.', "TikTok banned 15 of the reported accounts two weeks after ISD's reports.", 'TikTok had banned 23 of the reported 50 accounts after one month.', 'TikTok eventually banned a specific account that remained active for over a week after ISD reported it for hate speech.', 'TikTok banned an account soon after it advertised its backup account.', 'TikTok banned one channel at least four times, after which the user posted on Telegram to promote their new TikTok account.', 'TikTok takes down accounts or videos individually rather than addressing a wider network as an aggregate.', 'TikTok sometimes issues final warnings to users.', "TikTok banned one analyzed account before the report's completion."]
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Incident Reporting; Incident Investigation; Content Safety Controls; Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: ["Otter.ai responded publicly on X to Alex Bilzerian's thread about the transcript being shared.", 'Otter.ai stated that users have full control over conversation sharing permissions and can change, update, or stop the sharing permissions of a conversation at any time.', 'Otter.ai shared a link to a help guide showing how users can change their auto-share settings.', 'The unnamed investors profusely apologized to Alex Bilzerian after he brought the transcript to their attention.', 'Alex Bilzerian decided to kill the deal after receiving the transcript.', 'Otter and Zoom publicly advised users to adjust their settings to avoid unwanted sharing.', 'Otter strongly recommended asking for consent when using the tool in meetings.']

mitigation_taken: ['Students came forward to report that the altered images were being shared online.', 'School officials discovered the doctored photos after students reported them.', 'The Winnipeg Police Service conducted an investigation into the incident.', 'The Winnipeg Police Service concluded the investigation and laid no charges.', 'The Louis Riel School Division said it plans to provide in-class presentations about responsible internet use and consent for students.', 'The Louis Riel School Division said it expects to organize presentations for parents in the coming weeks.', 'Officials said the explicitly altered images received by the school would be uploaded to Project Arachnid to help get them deleted.']

mitigation_taken: ["A Starship employee asked police for the victim's contact information so he could contact her and offer their insurance information and promo codes.", 'Starship offered the victim its insurance information and promo codes for use on the service.', 'The Tempe Fire Department treated the injured employee at the scene.', 'Another employee took the injured worker to the campus medical center after she declined medical assistance on-scene.', "Police obtained video footage of the incident that corroborated the employee's recollection.", 'Starship stated that the case was thoroughly investigated at the time.', 'Starship said its insurer is handling the matter.', 'Starship initially asked police not to charge the student involved in the robot theft/return.', 'Starship later changed its position and asked police to arrest that student.', 'In the dorm-room incident, Starship initially told police it would not aid in prosecution.', 'Nine days later, Starship called police and decided it wished to aid in prosecution of the students.', "Starship provided police with information about the robot's movement and said it had evidence depicting vertical movement.", 'Police arrested the two students on felony theft charges based on the evidence.', 'Police obtained video from the Barstool Tempe TikTok account showing the robot in the dorm (that footage was later deleted).']

mitigation_taken: ['Character.AI said that the character violated its policies against impersonation.', "Character.AI removed the character that used Jennifer Ann Crecente's likeness.", 'Character.AI said it will examine whether further action is warranted.', 'Drew Crecente opened a case with Character.AI.', 'Drew Crecente received confirmation of an investigation from Character.AI as of 9:51 a.m.']

mitigation_taken: ["After reviewing The Post's findings, Miami police and local prosecutors announced plans to revise their policies to require clearer disclosure in every case involving facial recognition.", 'Miami Police Department said it would give prosecutors all information on the use of facial recognition in past and future cases.', 'Miami Police Department said it would begin training officers to always disclose the use of facial recognition in incident reports.', "The Miami-Dade state attorney's office instructed all local police departments to include information about facial recognition in public reports.", "The Miami-Dade state attorney's office said prosecutors would be proactive in asking police whether identifications were made with AI.", "The Miami-Dade state attorney's office said it would work on a policy moving forward rather than commit to reviewing all 186 identified cases.", "In response to The Post's reporting, Austin rewrote its policy to outlaw the practice of enlisting neighboring law enforcement agencies to circumvent local facial recognition bans.", 'Prosecutors in New Jersey reduced the charges against Francisco Arteaga as a result.', 'Charges were later dismissed against at least seven people who had been wrongfully arrested after misidentification by facial recognition.', "A judge excluded a facial recognition result from the state's case against an alleged thief after ruling the software does not consistently produce accurate results."]
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Training & Supportive Measures; Risk Disclosure; Governance Disclosure; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions

mitigation_taken: ['Francisco Arteaga filed a motion seeking detailed information about the facial recognition software used to identify him, including its name, manufacturer, algorithms, error rates, source code, analyst qualifications, the mugshot database, and any alterations to surveillance stills.', 'After the trial judge denied the motion, Arteaga appealed the decision to the appellate court.', 'A three-judge state appellate panel ruled in June 2023 that Arteaga was entitled to discovery of the facial recognition materials and returned the case to the trial court directing the judge to order prosecutors to provide those materials.', 'Prosecutors chose not to appeal the appellate ruling.', 'Arteaga pleaded guilty to the charges to secure his release after nearly four years in pretrial detention.', 'Since his release in November, Arteaga has studied holistic medicine online.', 'Since his release in November, Arteaga has sold health and nutrition products.', "Since his release in November, Arteaga has worked as a gym teacher at a senior citizens' center in Queens.", 'Since his release in November, Arteaga has moved to Union City to better accommodate monthly meetings with his parole agent.', 'Since his release in November, Arteaga has met with his son and fiancée every few weeks.', "In February 2022, the New Jersey Attorney General's office began soliciting public input about facial recognition technology to help shape a statewide policy on its use by law enforcement agencies.", 'Several lawsuits were filed against the New York Police Department over its use of facial recognition technology.', 'In 2022, a court ordered the New York Police Department to release records about its use of facial recognition technology.', 'Former New Jersey Attorney General Gurbir Grewal banned Clearview AI in 2020.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; System Documentation; Data Governance

mitigation_taken: ['FEMA created and published a webpage dedicated to dispelling rumors about Hurricane Helene.', 'Local print, television, and radio newsrooms conducted extensive coverage of Hurricane Helene and its aftermath.', 'Local newsrooms devoted part of their efforts to debunking rumors promoted by nonlocal actors on national platforms.', 'Legacy media organizations swatted back disinformation by fact-checking and correcting false claims and images about the storm.', 'News outlets examined viral images, identified AI-generated errors (such as a man with six fingers and three nostrils), and exposed those images as fake.']

Gavin Newsom vetoed the bill SB 1047.']

mitigation_taken: ['Cato CTRL security researchers discovered the threat actor ProKYC selling a deepfake tool.', 'Cato CTRL published a blog that includes a demo of ProKYC’s deepfake tool and outlines potential detection, mitigation, and prevention techniques.', 'Cato CTRL recommends collecting threat intelligence (including HUMINT and OSINT) and staying up to date on the latest cybercrime trends.', 'The report advises that high-quality pictures and videos and glitches in facial parts or inconsistent eye and lip movement should be treated as suspicious and manually verified by a human.', 'Cato CTRL stated it will continue to share these findings to help organizations be aware of the latest threats.']

filed a motion asking the prosecutor to provide Cybercheck's software for review in another case.", 'Donald Malarcik subpoenaed Adam Mosher.', "Donald Malarcik hired a digital forensics expert to mitigation_taken: ['Officials deactivated the facial recognition feature during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020.', 'The facial recognition system has remained turned off due to precautionary measures imposed by the judiciary.', 'The city of Buenos Aires initiated a legal battle to have the facial recognition system switched back on.', 'A judge ordered a judiciary investigation into the facial recognition system.', 'IT specialists, acting on a court order, searched the servers of the Ministry of Security as part of the investigation.', 'The judiciary produced a confidential investigation report that was signed off by two different police bodies.', 'The reporters initiated a legal inquiry with the assistance of a lawyer at the Contentious, Administrative and Tax Court of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires to request their personal data.', "The reporters filed a second inquiry with a public prosecutor's office specializing in corruption cases about their personal data.", "The public prosecutor's office confirmed the city's requests for the reporters' personal data and provided the dates and times of those requests.", "The reporters filed a FOIA request to the Ministry of Security after receiving no response from the Ministry's press office.", "The reporters objected to the city's FOIA refusal and are awaiting a new response."]
assigned_subcategories: System & Feature Restrictions; Incident Investigation; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Third-Party System Access; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['Jakob Rosin informed the sports club about the incorrect screen reader description.', 'Jakob Rosin helped the Estonian sports club fix the software issue on its website.', 'The sports club chose not to use AI on its website.', 'The National Federation of the Blind tries to work with companies to improve their digital products before pursuing legal action.', 'Software companies have begun to push AI-driven products to comply with upcoming European accessibility legislation.', 'Several businesses are providing bespoke services rather than automated overlays to create more compliant websites.', 'Level Access acquired overlay maker UserWay.', "Level Access's founder addressed criticisms of UserWay's technology.", 'Level Access promised accuracy and transparency in its marketing.', 'Many reputable accessibility companies aim to be more transparent about the limitations of AI.', "EqualWeb stated that the links with its overlay enabled on Zara's website are compliant with accessibility standards."]
assigned_subcategories: Incident Response & Recovery; Usage & Access Limitations; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Governance Disclosure; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['CBS ran the song through multiple AI audio detection tools and reported several results indicating the audio, or at least parts of it, were likely AI-generated.', 'Pindrop stated that their detection technology is often coupled with independent fact-checking to determine whether an image or piece of audio is made with AI.', 'Pindrop launched the Pindrop Pulse tool for social media and reported people entering about 10,000 suspicious files per month to check for deepfakes.', 'Pindrop labeled media files as synthetic versus not synthetic to identify AI-generated content.', 'Representatives for Justin Bieber did not respond to a request for comment about the song.', 'Justin Bieber and his PR team chose not to publicly address the deepfake.']

mitigation_taken: ['The head of Radio Krakow pulled the plug on the A.I. experiment.', 'He announced an abrupt termination of the A.I. presenters at Off Radio Krakow.', 'The A.I. presenters were replaced by music created and performed by humans.', 'The station clarified that the purported interview with Wislawa Szymborska had been fabricated by a machine.', "A biography on the station's website was rewritten to delete any mention of the presenter's sexual orientation.", 'An online petition was drafted by Lukasz Zaleski and Mateusz Demski warning that the case of Off Radio Krakow is a dangerous precedent.', 'A member of the National Radio and Television Council, Marzena Paczuska, wrote a letter to the culture minister assailing Mariusz Pulit for eliminating the human factor.', 'The minister of digitalization, Krzysztof Gawkowski, complained on the social media platform X that certain boundaries are being crossed in the use of A.I.', 'Off Radio Krakow removed the A.I. presenter Alex Szulc.', 'Off Radio Krakow removed the A.I. presenter Emilia Nowak.']
assigned_subcategories: Staged Deployment; System & Feature Restrictions; Content Safety Controls; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ['公安部公布了10起打击整治网络谣言违法犯罪的典型案例。', '对白某某已提起公诉。', '鹰潭市余江区人民法院对被告人王某合判处有期徒刑三年，缓刑五年。', '最高人民法院、最高人民检察院、公安部联合发布了《关于依法惩治网络暴力违法犯罪的指导意见》，并明确对利用深度合成等生成式人工智能技术发布违法信息的情形予以从重处罚。', '北京互联网法院一审认定被告使用原告声音开发涉案AI文本转语音产品构成侵权，判令赔偿原告25万元并书面赔礼道歉。', '江苏省张家港市人民检察院向市人民法院就一起敲诈勒索、诈骗案件提起公诉。', '各地检察机关按照最高检相关要求加大对非法获取人脸、声纹等敏感信息以及利用AI伪造人脸、声纹等犯罪的打击力度。', '全国公安机关依托“净网”专项行动组织专项会战打击相关犯罪。', '全国公安机关在“净网”专项行动中破获利用AI换脸进行诈骗犯罪案件79起并抓获515名犯罪嫌疑人。', '政法机关依法履职并持续深挖彻查AI犯罪。', '政法机关不断扩大办案战果并努力提升打击治理质效。', '政法机关会同相关部门深入推进行业治理和综合治理。', '有关部门压实主体责任以强化行业治理。', '有关部门强化行业监督并堵住监管漏洞。', '有关部门加速完善常态化治理机制以提高违法成本。', '全国公安机关联合国家重点实验室等单位开展了面向即时通信、网络直播、网络社交、电商平台、金融支付等重点App的人脸识别与活体检测技术安全测评。', '公安机关通报运营主体升级安全保护措施并要求升级人脸识别算法。', '各地通过多种形式开展宣传教育以提高公众对AI被利用或滥用带来法律风险的认识。', '合肥警方通过中央媒体节目揭秘谣言制作过程以开展宣传教育。', '杭州市临平区借助“反诈智能AI宣防外呼系统”自动识别、分析和预警潜在诈骗风险，并以电话语音形式向市民发送提醒信息。']
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Testing & Auditing; Data Governance; Model & Infrastructure Security

mitigation_taken: ['公安机关进行了调查，查明杨某某利用AI软件生成并发布“云南山体滑坡致8人遇难”的虚假新闻信息。', '公安机关已依法对杨某某进行行政处罚。', '公安机关进行了调查，查明罗某某利用AI软件生成虚假地震灾情图片并在短视频平台散布不实信息。', '公安机关已依法对罗某某进行行政处罚。', '公安机关进行了调查，查明田某利用AI工具加工生成并发布“澄城县一妇女电动车被查扣猝死”的虚假信息。', '田某对自己通过AI软件编造谣言的情况供认不讳。', '公安机关依法对田某处以行政处罚。']

mitigation_taken: ['四川网警积极行动，严厉整治涉AI类网络谣言。', '四川网警公布了10起AI造谣典型案例。', '四川广元公安机关已依法对杨某某进行行政处罚。', '四川凉山公安机关已依法对罗某某进行行政处罚。', '四川巴中公安机关已依法对尚某某进行行政处罚。', '四川成都公安机关已依法对张某进行行政处罚。', '四川达州公安机关已依法对周某进行行政处罚。', '四川成都公安机关已依法对陈某进行行政处罚。', '四川绵阳公安机关已依法对王某和柳某进行行政处罚。', '四川成都公安机关已依法对朱某进行行政处罚。', '四川凉山公安机关已依法对吉某某进行行政处罚。', '四川成都公安机关已依法对王某进行行政处罚。', '周某通过招募获取的300余个相关账号均已关停。', '周某利用AI工具编造的约42万余条虚假信息均已清除。', '网警发布提醒，呼吁公众不造谣、不信谣、不传谣，共建清朗网络空间。']

mitigation_taken: ["The student's grade was ultimately changed after the AI-detection flag.", 'The professor issued the student a strict warning that if her work was flagged again it would be treated the same as plagiarism.', 'Olmsted screen-recorded herself on her laptop while doing writing assignments to document her work.', 'Olmsted used Google Docs to track her changes and create a digital paper trail for assignments.', 'Olmsted attempted to tweak her vocabulary and syntax to avoid future AI-detection flags.', 'A student began prescreening his work with GPTZero before submitting assignments.', 'Some students uninstalled Grammarly plug-ins from their computers in response to AI-detection concerns.', "Some students used AI 'humanizer' services to automatically rewrite submissions to try to bypass AI detectors.", 'Grammarly developed a detection tool for students that identifies whether text was typed, pasted, or written by an AI model.', 'Turnitin said it is working to expand its AI product portfolio with a service to help students show the process of how they put together their written assignments.', 'Most schools that work with Copyleaks began giving students access to the service so students can authenticate themselves and see their own AI scores.', "Vanderbilt University and several other schools turned off Turnitin's AI detection service over accuracy concerns.", 'GPTZero reported it had made strides in debiasing results for ESL students.', "GPTZero said it has taken steps to more clearly indicate the level of uncertainty in its tool's assessment of written work.", 'Some educators have backed away from using AI-detection tools in response to concerns about their accuracy.', 'Some educators have adjusted their curricula to incorporate AI rather than relying on detection tools.', 'Turnitin said it intentionally oversamples underrepresented groups in its dataset to address bias concerns.']

mitigation_taken: Authorities seized Kamnik's workstation at Troop K, including a hard drive containing thousands of pornographic media files. Investigators discovered that some of the pornographic media files contained evidence they were made using deepfake software. Kamnik surrendered himself to authorities. Kamnik was later arraigned. Kamnik was charged with felony unauthorized use of a computer and misdemeanor misapplication of entrusted property. Kamnik was suspended without pay. The investigation is ongoing.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Incident Response & Recovery

mitigation_taken: GWLRA conducted an internal review. Following an internal review, GWLRA decided to terminate the use of YieldStar. GWLRA reached out to CBC with an email statement about its use of YieldStar. GWLRA emphasized in its communications that it has raised rents at an average rate of 3.5 percent per year across its portfolio. More than a hundred tenants sent complaints to the Competition Bureau demanding an investigation into landlords’ use of YieldStar in Canada. Tenants protested outside the Competition Bureau in Toronto demanding an investigation into landlords’ use of rental software. Tenants in Cynthia Black's building participated in a red flag protest by hanging flags from their balconies to warn tenants about the rent hikes. Tenants in West22 have had red flags hanging from their balconies for the past year. Some tenants flagged their concerns to local MPP Bhutila Karpoche. Bhutila Karpoche researched the issue and found YieldStar has been used in Canada since at least 2017. Federal Minister François-Philippe Champagne said he would write to the competition commissioner to launch an investigation into the allegations around price-fixing in the rental market. Dream instructed its property manager to discontinue its use of YieldStar in September. Dream stated that its pricing decisions have always been made solely by its management team based on publicly available data and information specific to its buildings. Dream denied that rent prices were in any way impacted by the software. The FBI investigated RealPage and landlords who use its software for alleged collusion, price-fixing and artificially inflating rents. The U.S. Department of Justice announced a lawsuit against RealPage. RealPage denied the FBI allegations and said the claims brought by the DOJ are devoid of merit. RealPage said it intends to vigorously defend itself against these accusations.
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; System & Feature Restrictions; Governance Disclosure; Incident Reporting; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions

mitigation_taken: The Facebook post containing the deepfake was reportedly removed. Sir Jim Mann publicly urged caution to people who encounter videos of experts that appear too good to be true. Sir Jim Mann advised people to source reliable information directly from recognized healthcare professionals. Dana Brems posted on Instagram to alert followers that a company used an AI clone of her voice to promote a product.
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; Training & Supportive Measures; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: After a deposition revealed a body-camera recording, the prosecutor requested the video from police. Police released the body-camera video to the defense. St. Louis Circuit Court Judge Brian May watched the video during a February 2024 hearing and ruled that the identification could not be used in court. Prosecutors dropped all charges against Christopher Gatlin in March. Christopher Gatlin sued the agencies and officers responsible for his arrest seeking unspecified monetary damages. Detroit paid Robert Williams $300,000 in a settlement announced in June. Detroit agreed to require officers to collect independent evidence on AI-identified suspects before seeking an arrest warrant. Woodbridge settled a lawsuit related to a wrongful arrest for $300,000 last year without admitting wrongdoing. Miami police launched an internal investigation into the handling of Jason Vernau's case. Prosecutors later dropped the case against Jason Vernau. All of the wrongful-arrest cases described in the reporting were eventually dismissed. Sawyer's wife drove 90 miles to personally confront a probation officer who had been pressured into falsely confirming him as the attacker. The probation officer apologized and retracted her confirmation, which led to Sawyer's release.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies; Safety Decision Frameworks; User Rights & Recourse

mitigation_taken: Check Point investigated FunkSec and published a public report detailing their findings. Check Point discovered and publicly disclosed that FunkSec released an AI chatbot based on Miniapps to support their malicious operations.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['A New Zealand private investigator found the website and alerted the couple to the danger its contents had put Hannah in.', 'Hannah and Kris ran the names of the women through Facebook to identify mutual friends and narrow down suspects.', 'Hannah and Kris went to the police with their evidence.', 'They approached criminal lawyer Sidnie Sarang, who started to build a case against Andy.', 'Hannah and Kris distanced themselves from their friendship group to avoid tipping off the suspect and jeopardising the case.', "Hannah and Kris declined Andy's invitations to meet or go for drinks.", 'They approached a private investigator who prepared a report into the evidence the couple had collected.', 'The private investigator sent the report to police.', "Police raided Andy's home.", 'Andy gave over his passwords to police.', 'Police charged Andy with 28 counts of using a carriage service to cause offence.', 'Andrew Thomas Hayler pleaded guilty to the charges.', 'He was sentenced to nine years in prison with a non-parole period of five years.', 'He appealed against his sentence.']

mitigation_taken: ['Barbara O’Neill posted a video clip on YouTube warning about the trend of AI-generated impersonations of her.', 'Barbara O’Neill publicly stated that she does not have a Facebook page of her own.', 'Africa Check debunked several AI-generated impersonations of Barbara O’Neill in July.', 'Africa Check published a guide to help readers identify deepfakes.']
assigned_subcategories: Risk Disclosure; Content Safety Controls; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['Norton published the 2025 Cyber Safety Insights Report surveying 1008 adults about cyber and dating-app scams.', 'The Amor app requires users to answer 60 questions when signing up.', 'The Amor app requires users to verify an email address.', 'Amor requires premium users to submit ID that is run through Stripe and verified in the cloud without Amor retaining the information.', 'Amor matches users based on their questionnaire answers rather than allowing matching based on photo likes.', 'Amor prevents bots from being onboarded into the app and blocks plugging AI/robots into the service.', 'The Amor app encourages users to put more thought and effort into online dating to reduce impulsive interactions.', "Private investigator Julia Hartley Moore told young men who had sent cash to online 'lovers' that they were likely not speaking to a real woman and provided that guidance.", 'Amor removed (kicked off) a user for attempting to promote an OnlyFans account on the site.']
assigned_subcategories: Access Management; Data Governance; Denial & Defensive Based Actions; System & Feature Restrictions; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: Microsoft filed an amended complaint naming the primary developers of malicious tools designed to bypass the guardrails of generative AI services. Microsoft filed a lawsuit alleging violations of U.S. law and Microsoft policies. Microsoft gathered additional information about the criminal enterprise. Microsoft prepared criminal referrals to U.S. and foreign law enforcement. The Court issued a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction enabling Microsoft to seize a website. Microsoft seized the website, disrupting the group's operations. Microsoft protected victims’ identities by excluding names and synthetic imagery. Legal filings were unsealed, generating reactions among group members.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Incident Response & Recovery; User Rights & Recourse

mitigation_taken: Truffle Security analyzed Common Crawl and found nearly 12,000 live secrets. Lasso Security uncovered thousands of exposed repositories and private tokens. Researchers warned that previously public information could remain accessible through AI tools. Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 found all tested GenAI products vulnerable to jailbreaking. Studies showed insecure fine-tuning could induce misalignment and that reasoning chains could be hijacked.
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Model & Infrastructure Security; Data Governance; Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: Meta fixed an error that caused inappropriate content recommendations. Meta apologized for the mistake. Meta stated the issue was unrelated to changes in content rules. Internet safety groups demanded explanations about the algorithm. The Molly Rose Foundation called for accountability.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Response & Recovery; Incident Reporting; Content Safety Controls

mitigation_taken: A Danish man was arrested. Twenty-five people were arrested globally in an operation targeting AI-generated child sexual abuse material. Europol identified 273 suspects across 19 countries and announced further arrests. Europol planned an online campaign highlighting consequences of AI misuse.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Incident Investigation; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: Police arrested suspects involved in deepfake scams. TikTok removed scam videos and associated accounts. TikTok committed to continued enforcement of community guidelines. TikTok and Meta worked with fact-checking organizations. Mafindo fact-checkers debunked the scams using advanced tools.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Content Safety Controls; Incident Response & Recovery; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['U.S. District Judge Kelly H. Rankin removed attorney Rudwin Ayala from the case.', 'Judge Rankin fined Rudwin Ayala $3,000 for violating legal ethics.', 'Rudwin Ayala withdrew the motions that contained the fabricated citations after the citations were challenged.', "Ayala's law firm agreed to pay the opposing lawyers' legal fees for the time spent defending against the bogus briefs.", 'Judge Rankin fined two other lawyers who signed onto the brief $1,000 each.', "Judge Rankin declined to punish Mr. Ayala's law firm."]
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies; Incident Response & Recovery

mitigation_taken: "Amnesty International's Security Lab conducted a forensic analysis of Slaviša Milanov's phone.", "Amnesty International's Security Lab conducted detailed forensic analysis on the mobile devices of two dozen activists and journalists.", 'The Security Lab used open-source tools, including the Mobile Verification Toolkit (MVT) and AndroidQF, to gather and analyse forensic evidence for the report.', "Amnesty International shared the report's findings with the Serbian government ahead of publication.", "Amnesty International shared the report's findings with Cellebrite prior to publication.", 'Amnesty International sent queries to Cellebrite during the research process.', 'In collaboration with security researchers at Google, Amnesty International identified a zero-day Android privilege escalation exploit which was patched during the course of the research.', 'The Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated that UNOPS is expected to conduct a thorough investigation of the alleged misuse of the donated Cellebrite technology.', 'Cellebrite sent a short response to Amnesty International asserting that it is not a surveillance company and that its products are licensed strictly for lawful use requiring a warrant or consent.', 'Cellebrite stated that it is investigating the claims made in the report.', 'Cellebrite said it is prepared to impose appropriate sanctions, including termination of its relationship with any relevant agencies, should the claims be validated.'
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Testing & Auditing; Incident Reporting; Model & Infrastructure Security; Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: ['Ben Fogle posted on Instagram warning that the deepfake of him promoting crypto circulating on Facebook was a scam.', 'The Financial Conduct Authority issued a notification warning that the AdmiralsFX site had been created by fraudsters to scam people.', 'The Financial Conduct Authority issued a notification warning that the related brand Golden Currencies was a clone being promoted by fraudsters.', 'Martin Lewis issued a public warning about the deepfake videos being used in the scams.', 'Zoe Ball issued a public warning about the deepfake videos being used in the scams.', 'Swedish broadcaster SVT and the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project shared a massive leak of data with the Guardian and international media partners.', 'Georgia’s prosecutor’s office said it is now looking into the Tbilisi call centre network.', 'UK parliamentarians pushed for a more urgent legislative response to address the problem.', 'Revolut said it takes fraud incredibly seriously and invests heavily to prevent it.', 'Kroo said it takes fraud incredibly seriously and invests heavily to prevent it.', 'Chase said it takes fraud incredibly seriously and invests heavily to prevent it.', 'Revolut blocked a £12,000 transfer attempt by a victim.', 'HSBC blocked a £12,000 transfer attempt by a victim.', 'Meta started a programme allowing banks to report these scams to help combat fraud.', 'Derek reported the fraud to Action Fraud.', 'Journalists confronted Akaki Kevkhishvili and his security guards on video.', 'The Guardian invited readers to share links to fake adverts or news articles via an encrypted form to help the investigation.', 'The Guardian offered SecureDrop as a way for people to submit information anonymously.', 'The Guardian stated it will delete any personal data when it no longer requires it for the purpose of the feature.', 'Mark said he is speaking up publicly to help younger generations avoid falling into a similar trap.']

mitigation_taken: ['Google informed Australian authorities and the eSafety Commission that it had received 258 user reports about suspected AI-generated deepfake terrorist or violent extremist content and 86 user reports alleging AI-generated child exploitation or abuse material.', 'Google provided the total global volume of Gemini user reports to the Australian eSafety Commission.', 'Google used hatch-matching to identify and remove child abuse material made with Gemini.', 'Google said it was committed to expanding its efforts to help keep Australians safe online.', 'The Australian eSafety Commission fined Telegram for shortcomings in its reports.', 'The Australian eSafety Commission fined Twitter (later renamed X) for shortcomings in its reports.', 'X lost one appeal about its fine of A$610,500.', 'X plans to appeal the fine again.', 'Telegram plans to challenge its fine.']

mitigation_taken: ['Within hours of its debut, the Los Angeles Times removed the AI-powered "insights" feature from Gustavo Arellano\'s column.']

mitigation_taken: ["YouTube released an official post warning creators about an AI-generated deepfake video of the company's CEO being used in phishing scams.", 'YouTube urged users not to fall for phishing scams.', 'YouTube advised creators to avoid clicking on links or opening files from untrusted sources.', 'YouTube stated that it will never attempt to contact users or share information through a private video.', "YouTube warned that the phishing scam could result in the loss of a creator's credentials and the installation of malware on their device."]

mitigation_taken: ['Viginum identified the Pravda network in February 2024 and published a report about it.', 'Viginum reported and confirmed the involvement of the Russian IT company TigerWeb and its directors in creating and administering the Pravda network.', 'NewsGuard conducted and published an audit testing 10 leading AI chatbots for reliance on Pravda network content.', "NewsGuard launched its AI Misinformation Monitor as a monthly evaluation in August 2024 and repeatedly documented chatbots' reliance on the Pravda network.", 'NewsGuard assigned the Pravda network a Trust Score of 7.5/100 and advised users to proceed with maximum caution.', 'NewsGuard tested the 10 chatbots using a sampling of 15 false narratives and three different prompt styles (Innocent, Leading, and Malign), resulting in 450 responses.', "The American Sunlight Project published a February 2025 report warning that the Pravda network was likely designed to manipulate AI models and describing the tactic as 'LLM grooming.'", 'The American Sunlight Project published findings estimating that the Pravda network produced approximately 3.6 million articles in 2024.', 'The Digital Forensics Research Lab published coverage and analysis of the Pravda network.', 'Recorded Future published reporting and analysis on the Pravda network.', "The Foundation for Defense of Democracies published analysis regarding the Pravda network's activities.", 'The European Digital Media Observatory published reporting on the expansion and activity of the Pravda network.']
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Incident Investigation; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Risk Disclosure; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['Microsoft released an analysis identifying the article and website as part of a Russia-based disinformation campaign.', 'The Microsoft Threat Analysis Center released a report on Sept. 17 describing the fake hit-and-run article as an example of Russian cyber influence operations targeting the Harris-Walz campaign.', 'The San Francisco Police Department emailed Reuters stating that there is "no merit" to the report.', 'The Reuters Fact Check team produced and published a fact-check article declaring the story false.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Gnida Project reported the fake Harris site.', "The Gnida Project stated that the domain has 'Russian connections.'", 'The Gnida Project noted that the fake Harris site resembles the fake Ensemble-24.fr domain.', 'NewsGuard identified similarities in tactics and design between the fake Harris website and Ensemble-24.fr.', 'NewsGuard found that both the fake Harris site and the fake French election site look like they were created by John Dougan.', 'NewsGuard published a Misinformation Fingerprint on the fake Harris site.', 'NewsGuard sent September 2024 emails seeking comment to the Harris campaign, the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence.']

mitigation_taken: ['Canadian law enforcement executed search warrants at the call centers in early June 2024.', 'A federal grand jury in the District of Vermont indicted the 25 alleged perpetrators in late February.', 'The indictment was unsealed on Tuesday.', 'All but two of the suspects were arrested in Canada on Tuesday.', 'U.S. prosecutors charged all 25 suspects with conspiracy to defraud and charged five suspects with conspiring to commit money laundering.', 'U.S. and Canadian law enforcement engaged in extensive cooperation between local and federal agencies in both countries to carry out the arrests.', 'Nine other people had been previously charged in Vermont in connection with the same scam.', 'The Federal Trade Commission urged people not to trust the voice on such calls and recommended that anyone pressured to send money should call or text the person who supposedly contacted them to verify the story.', 'People were encouraged to monitor resources like the AARP Fraud Watch Network Scam-Tracking Map and alerts from the Better Business Bureau.', "People were encouraged to report any suspicious calls on the Federal Trade Commission's website.", 'Fraud victims ages 60 or older were advised they can call the National Elder Fraud Hotline for assistance.']
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Training & Supportive Measures; User Rights & Recourse

mitigation_taken: ['CNN spokesperson Emily Kuhn told AFP that the video was completely manipulated and did not air.', "The U.S. State Department referred AFP to the agency's online transcript of Marco Rubio's interview.", 'AFP compared the interview transcript and footage to the viral clip and found nowhere in the conversation that Rubio mentioned Starlink.', "Media forensics expert Siwei Lyu analyzed the video's audio with AI-detection algorithms and concluded it was very likely AI-generated.", "Ukraine's Center for Countering Disinformation posted on X that the viral video of Rubio is fake.", 'Elon Musk posted on X that Starlink will never turn off its terminals and that he would not remove the service from Ukraine.', 'Marco Rubio posted on X denying that anyone had made threats about cutting Ukraine off from Starlink.']

mitigation_taken: ['Graphika published a report investigating chatbot personas that promote harmful behaviors.', 'Graphika’s investigation identified at least 10,000 AI chatbots that were directly advertised as sexualized, minor-presenting personas.', 'Graphika’s investigation found that some of these chatbots made calls to APIs for OpenAI’s ChatGPT, Anthropic’s Claude, and Google’s Gemini.', 'Many small startup companies operating template chatbot platforms are trying to figure out how to address abuse on their platforms by improving moderation.', "Dr. Alexis Conason has spoken out about the negative impact of AI chatbots on teenagers' mental health."]

mitigation_taken: ['Yale barred Dr. Helyeh Doutaghi from its New Haven campus.', 'Yale placed Dr. Helyeh Doutaghi on administrative leave.', 'Yale told Dr. Doutaghi not to advertise her affiliation with the university.', 'Yale Law School immediately opened an investigation into the matter to ascertain the facts.', 'Yale asked Dr. Doutaghi to meet with university officials to explain her position.', 'Dr. Doutaghi retained a lawyer, Eric Lee, to represent her.', "Eric Lee asked the school to take public action to restore Dr. Doutaghi's reputation.", "Jewish Onliner responded to requests for comment through an AI assistant identifying itself as 'JO.'", 'Jewish Onliner later sent emails stating that it uses AI to enhance research, fact-checking and rapid content creation while final edits are done by humans.', 'The Law and Political Economy Project scrubbed the webpage describing the discussion that featured Dr. Doutaghi from its project website.', 'The New York Times issued a correction on March 12, 2025 clarifying the date on the letter from a Yale official to Dr. Doutaghi.']

mitigation_taken: ['Céline Dion posted an Instagram statement warning that unsanctioned AI-generated recordings purporting to contain her performances are fake, not approved, and not part of her official discography.', "More than 200 artists signed an open letter, organized with the Artists Rights Alliance, denouncing AI-music generation technology and calling on AI developers, technology companies, platforms, and digital music services to cease using AI to infringe upon and devalue artists' rights.", 'In February, dozens of UK artists released a collaborative silent album to protest UK copyright laws involving AI.', 'Céline Dion’s management team and Sony Music Entertainment Canada Inc. issued a statement saying they became aware of unauthorized use of her video, recording, musical performance, and likeness at a Donald Trump/JD Vance campaign rally and asserting that the use was not authorized and that she does not endorse it.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Singapore Police Force, Monetary Authority of Singapore and Cyber Security Agency of Singapore advised businesses to establish protocols for employees to verify the authenticity of any video calls or messages.', 'The authorities advised businesses to check for tell-tale signs that could suggest manipulation of the audio or video through AI technology.', 'Victims verified with their company’s actual executives and legal counsel to confirm that those executives did not participate in any video calls and did not authorize any fund transfers.']

mitigation_taken: ['WPP CEO Mark Read sent an email to company leadership detailing the attempted fraud, warning staff to be vigilant, and listing red flags such as requests for passports, money transfers, and secret transactions.', "WPP added a pop-up message on its contact page warning that WPP's name and those of its agencies had been fraudulently used by third parties on unofficial websites and apps.", 'WPP stated on its website that it had been dealing with fake sites using its brand name.', 'WPP said it was working with relevant authorities to stop the fraud.']

mitigation_taken: ['Prime Minister Lawrence Wong publicly warned about deepfake videos and images of him being used to sell products or services.', 'He told people not to respond to these scams.', 'He told people not to share any of their personal information.', 'He urged people to report such scams via ScamShield.', 'He advised those who have fallen victim to make a police report online.', 'He reminded people to stay vigilant online.', 'Senior Minister Lee Hsien Loong publicly warned about deepfake videos of him commenting on international relations and foreign leaders.', 'He asked members of the public in December 2023 not to respond to scam videos promising guaranteed returns on investments or giveaways.', 'Viewers were advised to look out for visual and audio anomalies in deepfake videos, such as atypical facial movements or blinking patterns and noticeable edits around the face.']

mitigation_taken: ['Prime Minister Lee included the recent deepfake video circulating online in his Facebook post.', 'Prime Minister Lee urged Singaporeans to remain vigilant and learn to protect themselves and their loved ones against deepfake scams.', 'Prime Minister Lee urged people not to respond if they receive such scam videos.', 'Prime Minister Lee encouraged people to report such video scams, false news, or advertisements using the official ScamShield Bot on WhatsApp.', "Prime Minister Lee noted that official videos posted by the Prime Minister's Office can be found online and provided a link.", 'Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong posted on Facebook that he was aware of deepfake scam posts and messages showing him endorsing products and spreading misinformation.', 'Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong stated that these posts were falsehoods.', 'Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong urged people to stay vigilant and discerning online.']

mitigation_taken: ['A complaint was filed on January 29.', 'School officials passed that complaint along to the Corinth Police Department.', 'Authorities arrested 30-year-old Corinth School District educator Wilson Jones on two charges of production of a morphed image of child pornography.', 'The Corinth Police Department, along with the FBI, carried out a search warrant on March 3.', 'Authorities seized a laptop and a thumb drive, among other items.', 'The CPD emphasized that the images in those videos were AI-generated.', 'The CPD stated that at no time did the students willingly produce any of that content or know that their pictures were being used to create the videos.', "CPD Chief Landon Tucker passed the case along to the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office.", 'CPD asked anyone who thinks that they, or their child, may be a victim of any misconduct by Jones to call 662-286-3377.']

mitigation_taken: ['DNSFilter found that traffic to malicious domains with "tax" in the name peaked 30 days before Tax Day in 2024.', 'Guardio tracked a 77% increase in tax-related phishing scams in 2025.', 'McAfee reported that the average tax scam victim last year lost $8,199.', 'The IRS warned that it will never threaten legal action, promise a refund, demand payment through text or email, or call to ask for your credit or debit card information over the phone.', 'The IRS instructed taxpayers to ignore phishing texts asking for personal information to receive economic impact payments.', 'The IRS stated that eligible taxpayers do not need to take any action to receive the legitimate recovery rebate credit payments.', 'The IRS warned taxpayers to be wary of scam preparers, including those who set up fake websites or act as "ghost preparers" who refuse to provide their PTIN.', "The IRS advised taxpayers to ask for a preparer's PTIN up front.", 'The IRS advised taxpayers to use the IRS.gov website to find preparers in their area who currently hold professional credentials recognized by the IRS.', 'The article advised that official government websites always end in .gov and that sites purporting to be the IRS ending in .org, .com, or other domains should be treated as red flags.', 'The IRS cautioned against taking tax advice from TikTok or other social media platforms.']

mitigation_taken: ['Waverley College informed the NSW Education Standards Authority about the predictive text problem.', 'Waverley College told students to retake the NAPLAN writing test using a new prompt.', 'Waverley College attempted to administer the rescheduled writing test the following day.', 'Waverley College made multiple requests for the necessary student profile codes to allow students to access the rescheduled test.', 'Waverley College students sat the rescheduled writing test on Monday.', 'A Kambala teacher identified the predictive text issue and alerted the NSW Education Standards Authority and the Australian Curriculum and Reporting Authority.', 'NESA reminded all schools on the second day of testing of the need to disable predictive text on devices.', 'NESA said it has worked closely with the small number of schools who reported the predictive text issue.', 'NESA asked schools to continue self-reporting any issues that arise during the testing period.', 'Randwick High apologised for any inconvenience caused by the administrative error.']

mitigation_taken: ['Europol published the EU-SOCTA 2025 report.', "The EU-SOCTA 2025 provides a roadmap for Europe's law enforcement and policymakers to stay ahead of organised crime.", 'Europol said it will reinforce its capabilities by expanding its intelligence, operational reach, and partnerships.', 'The report calls for targeting criminal finances to dismantle the systems that allow organised crime to thrive.', 'The report calls for disrupting criminal supply chains to weaken organised crime operations.', "The report calls for staying ahead of criminals' use of technology.", "The EU's internal security strategy will address the challenges identified in the SOCTA report.", 'Poland stated it is fully mobilised to identify and neutralise emerging threats such as drug and human smuggling, human trafficking, hybrid threats, and the illicit arms trade.', 'Poland said it will shape the next EMPACT cycle and lay the foundation for international police cooperation.', "Guided by SOCTA, the Polish presidency committed to strengthening EMPACT and Europol to ensure EU support meets Member States' needs.", 'The Council of the European Union will set priorities for law enforcement action and guide the development of EMPACT operational plans for the next four years.', 'Law enforcement must integrate cross-cutting elements into their strategies when designing measures to tackle serious and organised crime.', 'Law enforcement will integrate strategies that target key criminal markets.', 'Law enforcement will integrate strategies that target the underlying mechanisms that sustain organised crime.']
assigned_subcategories: Risk Management; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ["The New York Times sued OpenAI and Microsoft in federal court in Manhattan over the companies' use of its articles to train AI.", 'OpenAI issued a public statement saying it respects the rights of content creators and is committed to working with them to ensure they benefit from AI technology and new revenue models.', 'OpenAI said its ongoing conversations with the New York Times have been productive and moving forward constructively.', 'OpenAI has been negotiating deals with news organizations to pay them for content.', 'In July, OpenAI signed a deal with the Associated Press for access to its archive of news articles.', 'German publishing company Axel Springer signed a deal with OpenAI under which OpenAI will pay to show parts of articles in ChatGPT answers.', 'At least 583 news organizations installed blockers on their websites to prevent tech companies from scraping their articles.', 'Several media companies started internal conversations on how to use emerging automated tools to assist with newsgathering and production.', 'Some authors, including George R.R. Martin, Jodi Picoult, Jonathan Franzen and George Saunders, sued OpenAI.', "The Washington Post said it was reviewing the New York Times's complaint closely and supported the Times' decision to protect copyright principles.", 'Google pitched media outlets on building and selling AI tools that could assist journalists.']

mitigation_taken: ['Authors Sarah Silverman, Richard Kadrey, and Christopher Golden filed a lawsuit in California alleging Meta violated copyright by using their books to train LLaMA.', 'A Danish anti-piracy group sent a takedown notice to The-Eye.eu concerning the Pile/Books3 dataset.', 'Bloomberg confirmed it will not include the Books3 dataset among the data sources used to train future versions of BloombergGPT.', 'EleutherAI stated it is creating a version of the Pile that exclusively contains documents licensed for that use.', 'Meta issued a DMCA takedown order against at least one developer distributing the leaked LLaMA model.', 'Meta required developers to agree to a license before using the LLaMA model.', 'Meta required developers to agree to a license before using the new version of the model released last month.']

mitigation_taken: ["Meta argued in court that training their generative-AI models on copyrighted work without a license is fair use because large language models 'transform' the original material.", 'OpenAI argued in court that training generative-AI models on copyrighted work without a license is fair use.', "Meta claimed it took precautions not to 'seed' any downloaded files.", "Meta claimed there are 'no facts to show' that it distributed the books to others.", 'Employees recommended removing data clearly marked as pirated or stolen.', 'Employees recommended not externally citing the use of any training data, including LibGen.', "Employees discussed removing any line containing 'ISBN', 'Copyright', '©', or 'All rights reserved' from the data.", 'A Llama-team senior manager suggested fine-tuning Llama to refuse to answer queries requesting verbatim reproduction of copyrighted text.', 'Employees discussed a variety of mitigations to mask their activity.', 'Elsevier filed a complaint against LibGen, Sci-Hub, other sites, and Alexandra Elbakyan, and the court granted an injunction and ordered Sci-Hub to pay $15 million in damages.', 'In 2023, a group of educational and professional publishers sued LibGen, and the court ordered LibGen to pay $30 million in damages and issued a broad anti-piracy injunction.']

mitigation_taken: ['OpenAI deployed safety teams dedicated to researching and reducing bias and other risks in its models.', 'OpenAI said it is working to further reduce the number of harmful generations from its AI video tool.', 'OpenAI is researching how to change its training data to generate less biased videos.', 'OpenAI is researching how to adjust user prompts to generate less biased videos.', 'OpenAI published a system card acknowledging that biased representations are an ongoing issue with Sora.', 'OpenAI previously introduced new techniques to its AI image tool to produce more diverse results.', 'WIRED worked with researchers to refine a methodology to test Sora for bias.', 'WIRED crafted 25 prompts designed to probe the limitations of AI video generators in representing humans.', 'WIRED asked Sora ten times to generate a video for each prompt to create a dataset while limiting environmental impact.', 'WIRED analyzed the videos it generated for factors like perceived gender, skin color, and age group.']

mitigation_taken: ['KDE GitLab banned the version of Microsoft Edge that the bots were claiming to be.', 'GNOME rate-limited non-logged-in users from viewing merge requests and commits.', 'GNOME switched to Anubis, a proof-of-work challenge page that requires browsers to perform computational work before granting access.', 'Jonathan Corbet warned LWN users that the website might be occasionally sluggish due to DDoS from AI scraper bots.', 'The Fedora project blocked a number of subnets to mitigate scraper traffic.', 'Fedora banned traffic from the entire country of Brazil by IP to restore service.', "Inkscape created a 'Prodigius' block list to block offending traffic.", 'A Frama Software administrator (BigGrizzly) built a list of approximately 460,000 IPs with spoofed user agents and banned those IPs.', 'BigGrizzly offered to share his 460,000‑IP block list with other organizations.', "'ai.robots.txt' published an open list of web crawlers associated with AI companies and provided a robots.txt implementing the Robots Exclusion Protocol.", "'ai.robots.txt' provided a .htaccess file that returns an error page when requests come from any AI crawler in their list.", 'Read the Docs blocked all AI crawlers, immediately decreasing their traffic by approximately 75%.']

mitigation_taken: ['Microsoft blocked imposters on Microsoft Azure.', 'Microsoft added anti-scam features to Microsoft Edge.', 'Microsoft implemented new features in Windows Quick Assist to fight tech support fraud.', 'Microsoft rejected 49,000 fraudulent partnership enrollments.', 'Microsoft blocked about 1.6 million bot signup attempts per hour.', 'Microsoft thwarted $4 billion in fraud attempts between April 2024 and April 2025.', 'Microsoft Defender for Cloud provides comprehensive threat protection for Azure resources, including vulnerability assessments and threat detection.', 'Microsoft Edge implemented website typo protection and domain impersonation protection using deep learning technology.', 'Microsoft Edge implemented a machine learning-based Scareware Blocker to identify and block potential scam pages and deceptive pop-up screens.', 'Microsoft suspended identified accounts and tenants associated with inauthentic behavior in response to Storm-1811 and other groups.', 'Microsoft encouraged people to report scammers to Microsoft at https://www.microsoft.com/reportascam.', 'In January 2025 Microsoft introduced a fraud prevention policy requiring product teams to perform fraud prevention assessments and implement fraud controls as part of their design process.', 'Microsoft developed domain impersonation protection using deep-learning at the domain creation stage to help protect against fraudulent e-commerce websites and fake job listings.', 'Microsoft developed AI-powered fake job detection systems for LinkedIn.', 'Microsoft integrated Microsoft Defender SmartScreen into Windows and Edge to help prevent unsafe browsing by analyzing websites, files, and applications based on their reputation and behavior.', "Microsoft's Digital Crimes Unit partnered with public and private sector organizations to disrupt malicious infrastructure used by criminals, resulting in hundreds of arrests and prison sentences.", "Microsoft's Digital Crimes Unit mitigation_taken: ['Hundreds of comments made by the researchers were deleted from Reddit.', "404 Media archived as many of the researchers' comments as possible before they were deleted.", 'The r/changemyview moderators posted a public disclosure revealing the unauthorized experiment to the subreddit community.', 'The researchers publicly answered several questions about the experiment on Reddit.', "The researchers declined to answer 404 Media's questions and declined to share their identities.", "The r/changemyview moderators decided to respect the principal investigator's request for privacy and not disclose their name.", "Reddit's automated spam filters shadowbanned 21 of the researchers' 34 accounts.", 'The researchers publicly defended their conduct and explained their rationale for not disclosing the experiment prior to running it.', '404 Media contacted the anonymous email address set up by the researchers to ask questions about the research.']
